loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngả, 65 years old, is one of the first 20 members of the TYM Fund. She joins in 1992. Her first loan of $20 was to buy few livestock. It yielded a successful result and she continues to take out loans to invest in her livestock business. The family’s economy improves. In the last 5 years she changes her business plan to the party-ware for rent to fulfill the needs from people in her area. After 10 years with the Fund she got a land lot which values $7500 at current market. All her nine children are grown-up. Though she is a bit older she still wants to be active and with the Fund instead of depend on her children. Her average monthly income is 270-300USD. She is applying for a loan of $1200 in vest more to her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngả, 65 tuổi, là 1 trong 20 thành viên đầu tiên của Quỹ Tình thương tham gia năm 1992. Khởi đầu với số vốn 20USD chị Ngả đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Kết thúc năm đầu với kết quả khả quan, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị vẫn đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn và gà. Nhờ tính toán sử dụng vốn hợp lý và cơ chế hoàn trả thuận lợi của Quỹ nên kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên rõ rệt. Trong thời gian 5 năm trở lại đây, trước nhu cầu thực tế tại địa phương chị Ngả đã bàn với chồng và đầu tư kinh doanh cho thuê phông bạt, bát đĩa, loa đài phục vụ đám hiếu, hỷ. Sau hơn 10 năm tham gia Quỹ nhờ những đồng vốn vay và sự năng động, cần cù chịu khó của cả gia đình, chị đã mua được mảnh đất trị giá 7500USD ngay mặt đường liên thôn. Hiện nay tuy tuổi đã khá cao, 9 người con đều đã trưởng thành, nhưng nguyện vọng của chị Ngả là muốn tiếp tục tham gia Quỹ vay vốn làm kinh tế. Chị tâm sự: mình còn khỏe, còn lao động được thì không nên trông chờ ỷ lại vào con cháu. Với thu nhập hiện tại là 270-300USD/tháng, vòng vốn này chị đề nghị xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm bàn ghế, bát đĩa cho thuê.

loans.use: Invest in a party-ware for rent business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for TYM Fund - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jroge is a very hard working individual, and he is married and has a son aged 3 years. When he was born he didn't have a steady job, and there was a great deal of economic uncertainty in his home, which is why he started his business 5 years ago. He purchase a car and since he didn't have s steady job he bought a taxi permit. Today he counts on this job and it provides his family with their needs.

He is requesting a loan of $1125 that he will repay in a term of 6 months to renovate his service station, so that he might provide better costomer service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, esta casado y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Cuando nació su hijo el no tenia un trabajo estable, había mucha incertidumbre económica en su hogar por lo que hace 5 años empezó su negocio compro un carro, y al no tener un trabajo fijo compro unas placas para operarlo como taxi. Actualmente cuenta con una base de taxis y este trabajo le provee lo necesario para mantener a su familia.

El solicita un crédito por US $1,125 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su estación de servicio para mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: To renovate his service station

loans.name: Monico

texts.es:
Mónico P. is married and has 4 children, who are 28, 27, 25, and 18. Previously, he was an employee at a tortilla factory, until he decided to start his own business to improve his economic situation, which was very unstable at that time. His tortilla factory became a family business since it started 10 years ago since Don Mónico and his children made them and delivered them themselves.

Currently, he needs a credit of $1,125, which he will repay in 6 months, to remodel his location and to fix up a sales area to better attend to his clients. With your help, Mónico will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mónico P. es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 27, 25 y 18 años. El anteriormente fue empleado de una tortillería, hasta que decidió poner su propio negocio para mejorar la situación económica que en ese tiempo era muy precaria. La tortillería se volvió un negocio familiar desde que inicio hace 10 años ya que Don Monico y sus hijos las fabricaban y ellos mismos repartían las tortillas.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $1,125 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y acondicionar una área de ventas para mejor la atención a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Mónico prosperara.

loans.use: To remodel his business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a divorced woman. She lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon. She used to work as a teacher in an elementary school, but now she is retired. She has a daughter who is a student.

After her retirement she started to sell beauty products with some of her friends, relatives and neighbors. Now, she has a large customer base and has also incorporated the sale of food supplements into her business, which has been very well-received by her clients.

In order to grow her business Catalina needs a loan of $850 to purchase more merchandise. She promises to pay this back in six months. You can help her to have a successful business. She will appreciate your help.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.en:
Rosa Elia is 46 years old. She has two children, ages 16 and 20. Her husband, Arnoldo, works as a taxi driver. Four years ago, Rosa was worried about her family, because her husband's increases weren't enough to support the family. Rosa is an enterprising woman, and she decided to make some handcrafted articles for home-interior decoration. After that she learned how to make some handcrafted jewelry. This was just one year ago, but this business is giving the family more money. Now she has started to teach others how to make what she makes, so she has also become a teacher.

In order to have more merchandise she needs a loan of $475. With your help, she will buy some merchandise to make more products and increase her clientele. She promises to repay in six months. You can be part of her dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
Norma Elena is married and has three girls, who are 8, 5, and 3. Her husband works. She started selling shoes by catalog 2 years ago through the invitation of a friend. She did this to support her husband with the costs of their home, but above all, to pay for the education of her young girls. She initially offered her products to family members and friends, but little by little, they recommended her, and her clientele has grown.

Currently she requires a credit of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and to be able to deliver her orders on time. With your help, Norma will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Norma Elena es casada y tiene 3 niñas de 8,5 y 3 años, su esposo trabaja como obrero, ella emprendió la venta de calzado por catalogo hace 2 años por invitación de una amiga, lo hizo para apoyar a su marido en los gastos de la casa pero sobretodo para pagar la educación de sus pequeñas. Inicialmente ofrecía sus productos a sus familiares y amistades, pero poco a poco estos la han ido recomendando y ha incrementado su clientela.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía, y así poder entregar a tiempo los pedidos que ya le realizaron, con tu apoyo norma seguirá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa C. has two 10-year-old girls and a 7-year-old boy, who are in primary school. Her husband works at a company near their town. Seven years ago, she started selling shoes by catalog to help her husband with the costs of the family and to offer a better quality of life to their children.

Now she is requesting a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise, mainly for the new spring/summer season. With your help, Tere will be able to continue supporting her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Teresa C. tiene 2 niñas de 10 años y un niño de 7 años quienes cursan la primaria, su esposo es obrero en una empresa cercana a la localidad. Desde hace 7 años se inicio en la venta de zapatos por catalogo para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la familia y así ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía, principalmente de la nueva temporada primavera-verano. Con tu contribución Tere seguirá apoyando a su esposo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mayra Nelly

texts.es:
Mayra A. is a divorced woman who has two sons, one who is 12, and one who is 8. Both are in school. After separating from her husband, she took charge of all of the expenses of her sons and her home. Eight years ago, she started selling food, feeding some construction workers who were working near her house. Upon having success with this, she continued doing it, and this is how she has been able to take care of her children. Now she has regular customers.

Currently she needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase some chairs and tables, which will let her offer better service and comfort to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Mayra A. es una mujer divorciada que tiene 2 hijos uno de 12 y otro de 8 años, ambos están estudiando. Al separarse de su esposo se hizo cargo de los gastos de sus hijos y de su casa, hace 8 años inicio vendiendo su comida, dándole de comer a unos albañiles que estaban trabajando por su casa, y al tener éxito con esto continuo haciéndolo y es lo que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus pequeños, actualmente ya tiene sus clientes asiduos.

Actualmente requiere un apoyo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar algunas sillas y mesas, brindándoles mejor servicio y mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase furniture

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe C. is divorced and has 4 children - 1 son who is 23 and 3 daughters, ages 32, 28 & 27. She began her business of selling bedspreads and blankets, three years ago to help herself economically and to be able to have a better life, since after she divorced her husband, he stopped helping her financially. With hard work and a lot of effort, she has been able to prosper and generate an income of her own.

Now, she is applying for a loan of $475 USD, which she plans to re-pay within 6 months. She'll use these funds to purchase new merchandise to sell in her business. With your help, Maria will be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe C. es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos un hombre de 23, tres mujeres de 32, 28 y 27 años. inicio su negocio de venta de colchones y edredones hace 3 años para ayudarse en el sustento económico y tener un mejor nivel de vida ya que después de su divorcio, dejo de percibir ingresos por parte de su esposo. Con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ella ha podido prosperar y generar un ingreso.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara a 6 meses comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Maria continuara su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise. (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Claudia Medeliana

texts.es:
Claudia A. is an enterprising businesswoman. Her mother always made a living by selling things, and this is how Claudia inherited her love of it, and it also provides extra income for her home. She has done this for three years, and her clientele has grown. She hopes to consolidate her business and establish sales in nearby towns. She sells clothing and shoes. She is married and has an 8-month-old son.

Now she needs a credit of $475, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise. With your contribution, Claudia will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Claudia A. es una mujer emprendedora de negocios, su mama se dedico siempre a las ventas y de ahí ella heredo el gusto por ellas, además de ser un apoyo extra para los gastos del hogar, se dedica a este giro desde hace 3 años, y su clientela a crecido, desea consolidarse y establecer ventas en pueblos cercanos. Ella vende ropa y calzado. Es casada y tiene un hijo de 8 meses.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu contribución claudia seguirá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Landy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Landy is married and has 3 children: 2 girls who are 17 and 15, and a 12-year-old boy. For 7 years, she has sold food out of her home. She has a broad clientele and usually sells take-out food. She started this business as a distraction, but it has become the principal source of income for their home. She now hopes to fix up her porch to make her kitchen more accessible to her clients.

Now she hopes to fix up her house so it is more accessible to her clients, and she is requesting a loan of $675, which she will repay in 6 months. With your help, Landy will continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Landy es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 mujeres de 17 y 15 años y un varón de 12 años. Hace 7 años esta operando en su casa una cocina económica, cuenta con una clientela amplia y generalmente la comida es para llevar, este negocio lo inicio como una distracción pero se ha convertido en la principal fuente de ingresos de su casa, ahora desea habilitar su porche para colocar la cocina en un mejor acceso para sus clientes.

Ahora desea habilitar su casa para que sus clientes tengan mejor acceso y solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Landy continuara con su cocina.

loans.use: To remodel her location

loans.name: Juana Laura

texts.es:
Juana Laura is hard-working and optimistic. She is separated from her husband and has a 10 year old daughter, who attends elementary school. She started her business buying and selling used clothing and selling household products because she needed extra income, since the money she receives from her husband for their daughter's expenses, is not enough.

Her business begun in December 2006, while she lived in the city of Reynosa. It was there that she began selling used clothing, but later her husband was relocated to the city of Altamira, and so she took up the business of selling in the town's markets (on the experience she had gained in the city of Reynosa). It was at this time that she also initiated the sale of household products through catalogues. This is going very well because her customer base is growing all the time.

Now, she is requesting a loan of $ 300 USD, which she will repay in three months. She'll use this loan to purchase bales of used clothing, which will allow her to offer more variety of garments to her clients. This will also help her introduce the sale of sandals and sneakers into her product offering. She plans to also purchase additional household products for resale. With your help, Laura will be able to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Juana laura es una persona muy trabajadora y optimista. Esta separa de su esposo y tiene una hija de 10 años que cursa la primaria, inició el negocio compra y venta de ropa usada y venta de productos para el hogar por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra ya que se separo de su esposo y con lo que él le da para los gastos de la niña no le alcanzaba, entonces decidió iniciar su propio negocio.

Comenzó en Diciembre de 2006, ella vivía en la ciudad de Reynosa y fue allí en donde empezó a vender ropa usada, pero después cambiaron a su esposo a la ciudad de Altamira y allí retomé el negocio vendiendo en los mercados ambulantes de la localidad aprovechando la experiencia que había adquirido en la ciudad de Reynosa. También esta iniciado la venta de productos para el hogar por catálogo y le esta yendo muy bien pues cada vez tiene más clientes

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir pacas de ropa usada que me permita tener mas variedad de prendas para sus clientes, introduciendo también sandalias y tenis, así como para la compra de productos para el hogar. Con tu ayuda laura continuara su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell through her business (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Juana Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes R. is single and she considers herself to be hard working, honest, happy and a great optimist. She started her business because she stopped working in a mall where she was employed ans she was left without any income that would allow her to meet her needs and those of her mother that depends on her. She is single and has no other support.

She started in January 1991 when she stopped working in the mall, she started with a small office supplies store from a room remodelled in her house, taken advantage of the fact that the house is on a well travelled area. She also sold house hold products and beauty products of well-known brands, but in February 1995 her aunt convinced her to start selling gold jewlery since Valentine's day was just around the corner and she travelled to the city of Guadalajara to purchase the products. She followed her advice and this is how she started her jewlery store, but then fashions changed and fashion jewlery and silvery jewlery became popular. She bought some magazines to learn how to make these and she really enjoyed this job, one which until present day she has been doing and has seen success.

She now requests a loan of $575 that she will repay in a term of 6 months to purchase the materials that she needs to make necklaces and braceletes that are in fashion and offer these to her clients and increase her sales. With your help Lourdes will continue to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes Ramírez es soltera y se considera una persona trabajadora, honesta, alegre y muy optimista. Inició el negocio Porqué dejo de trabajar en una tienda comercial donde era empleada y se quedé sin ningún ingreso que le permitiera solventar sus necesidades y las de su madre la cual depende de ella, ya que es una mujer sola que no tiene el apoyo de ninguna persona.

Comenzó en Enero de 1991, cuando dejo de trabajar como empleada, inicio con una papelería que acondiciono en su casa aprovechando que vive en una avenida muy transitada; además vendía productos para el hogar y de belleza de reconocidas marcas, pero en Febrero de 1995 una tía la convenció que vendiera joyería de oro ya que se acercaba el día de San Valentín y ella viajaba a la ciudad de Guadalajara a comprar, siguió su consejo y así empezó con la joyería, pero después salio la moda de los collares y pulseras de fantasía y plata, y empezó a comprar revistas para aprender a hacerlos y le gustó mucho y hasta la fecha se dedico a esto y me va muy bien.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir materiales que le permitan elaborar collares y pulseras de temporada para ofrecer en esta época del año a sus clientes y así poder incrementar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda Lourdes seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana S. is a hard workign, responsible and independent woman, a mother of 7 children: Virginia is 33 years old, and is a widow; Gerardo is 32 years old, and is married and living in the US; Juan Martin is 22 years old, is married and working; Marcario is 21 years old, is single and working; Yolanda is 19 years old and is married; Jesus is 18 years old and is single, working with his brother Luis Fernando, aged 16 years old and single.

She started her business for the need to have an income to support her children and now also her grandchildren, to provide them with a better life, and besides, she very much likes sales. First she started out doing laundry and ironing clothes and cleaning the houses of her neighbours and a few other jobs here and there that provided her enough income to support her children. But since April 2002 she started selling used clothing, and her son living in the US started sending her big boxes of used clothes for resale and in this way support her kids and grandkids.

She is requesting a loan of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 3 months to purchase more used clothing and have a better selection to offer her clients, and this way increase her sales and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana S. es una persona muy luchadora, responsable e independiente tiene 7 hijos, Virginia de 33 años, viuda; Gerardo de 32 años, casado, vive en E.U.A.; Juan Martín de 22 años, casado, trabaja; Macario de 21 años, soltero, trabaja; Yolanda de 19 años, casada; Jesús de 18 años, soltero, trabaja y Luís Fernando de 16 años, soltero, trabaja.

Inició el negocio por el deseo de tener un ingreso para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora a sus nietos también y darles una vida mejor, además de que le gustan mucho las ventas. Primero comenzó lavando y planchando ropa ajena y haciendo el aseo en casas de sus vecinas y algunas otras actividades que le daban ingresos para sostener a sus hijos, pero a partir de Abril de 2002 fue que comenzó a vender ropa usada, cuando su hijo que vive en los E.U.A. le empezó a mandar pacas de ropa usada para venderlas y de esta forma mantener a sus otros hijos y también ayudar a sus nietos.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir mas pacas de ropas y tener un mejor surtido que ofrecerle a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen is married with Jose Olivo Moldonado and they have two children aged 24 and 19 years old. She started her business when she was invited to joint a group in selling a prestigious brand of cometics and she liked the idea, especially because the income they earn is from her husband and she contributes what she can to the household finances.

Her motivation rested on the fact that she wanted to help with the household expenses and since her husband is now retired they needed an income to cover the extra family expenses. So she entered the sales group and it has helped her because she many more people and at the same time she is doing something productive, and provides for their needs. She started her sales 6 years ago and it has gone very well. At the beginning she only had a few clients but now she has a larger clientele and in this type of business the same clients recommend to others and the circle of sales keeps on growing, so long as the orders are filled and the costumer service is right.

She needs a loan of $100 US that she will repay in a term of 3 months, a loan that will help her fill the orders that have been made and are outstanding, and this way she will be able to fulfill the commitment to her clients. With your help Carment will continue to see success.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Carmen esta casada con José Olivo Maldonado y tiene dos hijos de 24 y 19 años. Inició el negocio cuando la invitaron a integrar parte del grupo de venta de una prestigiada marca de cosméticos y le gusto la idea, ya que los ingresos que tienen son por parte de su marido pero ella apoya con lo que puede a la economía de su casa.

Su motivación fue que quería ayudar con los gastos de la casa y como su marido ya esta jubilado necesitaba un ingreso extra para los gastos de la casa. Por eso entro al grupo de ventas y le sirve porque conoce a mas personas y a la vez hace algo productivo, que genere utilidades. Comenzó a vender hace 6 años y le ha ido muy bien, porque tenia muy poquitos clientes en un comienzo pero ahora ya tiene mas clientela y en este tipo de productos la misma gente la va recomendando con otras y se va ampliando el circulo de ventas, siempre y cuando les cumplas con sus pedidos y les des un buen trato.

Requiere un crédito por US $100 que pagara en 3 meses y le va ayudar a sacar adelante un pedido de mercancía que tiene pendiente y así cumplir con el compromiso que tiene con la gente. Con tu ayuda carmen podrá seguir prosperando.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan E. is married with Martina Ornelas Tobias, and they have five children aged 39, 37, 29, and 25 years old. He started teh business because he is now retired and he doesn't like to stay idle. He started his business selling cheeses and sausages from his house, to make up for the deficit left by his small pension. He needs to support his wife and cover the household costs.

He started more than 10 years ago with his business selling cheeses and sausages, and since the beginning he has been selling to his friends and neighbours and has had good results selling his products. Now he has his own clients and they themselves have been recommending him by word of mouth, and he even sells on credit to some of them because he knows that they will be good with their payments.

He is requesting a loan of $250 US which will be repaid in a term of 4 months so that he may restock his products and avoid being left empty handed. His clients always depend on him to have the selection they are looking for. With you help Adan will be able to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Adán E. esta casado con Martina Ornelas Tobías, tienen cinco hijos de 39, 37, 29, 27 y 25 años. Inició el negocio porque esta pensionado y no le gusta estar sin hacer nada, por eso inicio su propio negocio de venta de quesos y chorizo en su casa, ya que el dinero de la pensión no alcanza mucho y a pesa de ser solo el y su esposa aun tienen los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace más de 10 años con el negocio de los quesos y el chorizo, desde un comienzo se movió para ofrecer los productos con la gente conocida y los vecinos y tuvo buena respuesta ya que de inmediato se empezó a mover la mercancía. Ahora ya tiene sus propios clientes y ellos mismo lo han recomendando, e incluso algunos hasta les fía porque sabe que son cumplidos en sus pagos.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir de mas producto y no quedarse sin nada, porque la gente siempre confía en que el tiene surtido para cuando quieran. Con tu ayuda Don Adán podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nora Hilda

texts.es:
Nora T. is married with Juvention Ruben Rangel Pineda and they have four children aged 18, 14, 11 and 4 years old. She started her business because even though her husband worked very long hours they still didn't have enough to covery the household expenses. She set up a clothing store and a mechanic shop. Now that they are both working it's easier to cover the costs. She started her business more than 6 years ago and has been running well especially because the mechanic shop always has clients and sometimes they can't fill all the requirements. The clothing store is also running well but she is looking for a better place to set up her shop to improve her sales, especially because selling from her house can be difficult as they are located in a less travelled area.

She is requesting a loan of $475 US which she will repay in a term of 6 months, a loan that she will use to purchase more merchandise and some tools for the mechanic shop. With your help Nora will continue running her businesses successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora T. esta casada con Juventino Rubén Rangel Pineda y tienen cuatro hijo de 18, 14,11 y 4 años. Inició el negocio porque su esposo trabajaba mucho y no alcanzaba para los gastos de la casa. Por eso puso su negocio de ropa y también tiene un taller mecánico. Y con los dos trabajando es mas fácil sacar los gastos porque. Comenzó hace mas de 6 años con el negocio y le ha funcionado bien porque el taller siempre tiene clientes e incluso a veces les sobra trabajo, y la ropa también siempre se vende, en el negocio de la ropa trata de buscar un buen lugar donde colocarse para vender rápido porque en su casa es difícil que se venda porque esta en un lugar muy escondido

Ella solicita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y algunas herramientas para el taller mecánico. Con tu ayuda Nora seguirá operando exitosamente sus negocios.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es:
Maria Delfina is married and has two daughters, 11 and 15 years of age. She started the business because her salary was not enough. Then some acquaintances offer her the opportunity to sell shoes through catalogues and she liked the idea, because where she works they also sell, and she takes advantage to offer her merchandise. She started 3 years ago to sell shoes among her friends, and little by little she started selling more because at her day job she also has customers to whom she sells her merchandise. She has never been out of customers and her prices are accessible and she offers deferred payments. in fact, her daughters also help her sell among their friends and in this way she is able to increase her orders.

She requests a loan for US $475, which she will pay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and be able to cover pending orders because if she takes too long her customers may cancel their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Maria defina es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 15 y 11 años. Inició el negocio porque con el sueldo que recibe del trabajo que tiene no le alcanza entonces unas conocidas le ofrecieron integrarse a vender calzado por catalogo y le gusto la idea, porque donde trabaja también venden y aprovecha para ofrecer su mercancía. Comenzó hace mas de 3 años a vender la mercancía del calzado entre sus amigas, y poco a poco fue vendiendo mas porque en el trabajo donde esta también tiene clientes y aprovecha para colocar su mercancía. Nunca le han faltado clientes y además los precios son accesibles y dan facilidades de pago. De hecho sus hijas también le ayudan a vender entre sus amigas y con eso logra incrementar sus pedidos.

Requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder sacar los pedidos que tiene pendientes porque si se tarda en surtirlos le pueden cancelar el pedido los clientes.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia E. is married and has 2 children who are 6 and 10 years old. Her husband is an operator in a company. She started this business because of the necessity to support her husband with the family expenses. At that time she couldn't find a job, and didn't have anyone to watch her children, so she decided to help a friend with her sales and later on she started her business independently selling cosmetics.

She now requests a loan for US $575, which she will pay in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Antonia will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia E. es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 10 años; su esposo es operador en una empresa. Inicio el negocio ante la necesidad de apoyara su marido con los gastos familiares- en ese momento no encontraba trabajo y no tenia con quien dejar a sus hijos entonces decidió ayudarle a una amiga a vender y después se independizo dando inicio a su negocio de venta de cosméticos.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, con tu ayuda Antonia podrá seguir con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela P. is married and works selling shoes through catalogue. She started this activity to help her husband with the family expenses. She began selling to her relatives and friends, but little by little she increased her clientele. She started four years ago.

She is now requesting a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 4 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Adela will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Adela P. es casada y se dedica ala venta de zapatos por catalogo actividad que emprendió para ayudar a su esposo con lo gastos familiares primero empezó vendiendo a sus familiares y conocidos pero poco a poco ha incrementado su cartera de clientes, de esto ya 4 años.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprara mercancía. Con tu ayuda Adela seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Five years ago, Alejandro C. started selling jewelry through catalogue. He had to do this because he could not find a job and he needed an income to cover his expenses. Thanks to his hard work, he has made his business grow and currently has very good sales.

He is now requesting a loan for US $475, which he will pay in 6 months, to buy merchandise to sell and show, because given the nature of his business, many customers make up their mind when they see the jewelry physically and not through the catalogue. With your support Alejandro will be able to keep his business going.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandro C. hace 5 años inicio la venta de joyería por catalogo esto tuve que hacerlo debido que no encontraba trabajo, y necesitaba un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos. Gracias a su empeño ha hecho crecer su negocio y actualmente tiene buenas ventas.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para venta y exhibición ya que dada la naturaleza del negocio, muchos clientes se deciden hasta que ven las joyas físicamente y no por catalogo. Con tu apoyo Alejandro seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena T. is married and works selling clothes to contribute to the family expenses because her husband was not working and she needed to pay the service bills in her house. She started mostly with her relatives and now she sells at an itinerant market and in her own home.

She requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 4 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Lorena will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Lorena T. es casada y se dedica a la venta de ropa actividad para contribuir en los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo no estaba trabajando y necesitaba pagar los recibos de servicios de su casa, por lo que empezó primeramente con sus familiares, ahora lo hace en el mercado rodante y en su domicilio.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Lorena seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga M. studied to be a beautician. Five years ago she decided to set up her own beauty salon, first in her parents house, and now in her own. What motivated her to do this were the lack of jobs close to her home.

She now requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 3 months, to buy working tools, because she needs a machine to cut hair and materials for waxing. With your help Olga will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Olga M. estudio belleza, hace 5 años decidió poner su propia estética primero lo hizo en la casa de sus papas y ahora ya le tiene n su casa, lo que la motivo a hacer esto fue la falta de empleos cerca de su casa.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo, ya que requiere una maquina para corte de cabello y material para depilación. Con tu ayuda Olga seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying working tools (Comprar herramientas de trabajo)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa G. decided to have an activity that would generate her an income but that would allow her to take care of her two children. It was then that she decided to sell shoes through catalogues and she is currently doing very well because she has increased her clientele.

She requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 3 months, to buy merchandise and supply pending orders. With your help Rosa will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa González decidía a tener una actividad que le generara ingresos pero que le permitiera seguir al tanto de sus 2 hijos, fue que inicio en la venta de zapatos por catalogo, y actualmente le va muy bien ya que ha incrementado su cartera de clientes.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir pedidos pendientes. Con tu ayuda rosa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa G. works selling clothes through catalogue. She started on her own 2 years ago to have something to offer her daughter and to be able to offer her a better quality of life. Now she has been doing better with her sales and has been able to expand her business.

She requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay in 3 months, to buy clothes in bulk because this is cheaper, and when she sells them she will obtain better profits. With your support Rosa will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Gutiérrez se dedica ala venta de ropa por catalogo. Empezó por su cuenta hace 2 años para tener algo que ofrecerle a su hija así como brindarle mejor calidad de vida. Ahora le ha ido mejor con sus ventas y ha podio hacer crecer su negocio.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar pacas de ropa ya que son mas económicas ya si poder revenderlas y obtener mejores ganancias. Con tu apoyo rosa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es:
Veronica G. is married. Her husband works as a laborer in a company. Because of lack of financial resources to cover their expenses, she decided to work selling shoes more than three years ago. In the beginning she started selling only to her relatives, but little by little she has increased her clientele.

Now she requests a loan for US $475, which she will pay back in 6 months, to buy shoes in cash because that way she can get them at a better price and obtain better profits. With your contribution Veronica will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Verónica González es casada su esposo es obrero en una empresa. Debido a la falta de recursos económicos para solventar sus gastos ella decidió dedicarse a ala venta de zapatos hace más de tres años. Primero empezó solo vendiendo a su familia y poco a poco ha incrementado su clientela.

Ahora requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar zapatos de contado ya que así se los dan a un mejor precio y ella obtiene mejores ganancias. Con tu contribución verónica seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Yolanda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yolanda M. works selling cosmetics. Her husband works as a laborer and she started this activity to help her husband in supporting their household. Four years ago she mainly sold to her relatives but she now has customers from diverse circles and is doing very well.

She requests a loan for US $250, which she will pay back in 4 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Yolanda will be able to keep improving.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda M. se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos, su esposo es obrero empezó con esta actividad para apoyar a su marido en la manutención de su casa, hace 4 años principalmente le vendía a su familiares ahora ya a conseguido clientes de diversos círculos y le va muy bien.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Yolanda seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wardani

texts.id:
Ketut Wardani has 2 breeding female cows. They are the main source of income for her family. She and her husband collect grass on daily basis to feed their cows for her two children to feeds the cows with.

She bought her first cow 2 years ago. The 2nd one was just bought for IDR 4.5 million (around USD 498) recently after she got the loan. The rest of the money was used to buy the cattle feed. One of the cow is now pregnant.

She wants to use the money she can earn to build a permanent house for her family as now they live in a simple house made of dried leaves.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dua induk sapi yang dimiliki oleh Ketut Wardani adalah sebagai mata pencaharian tetap yang selama ini digeluti.Melalui Kegiatan inilah kebutuhan Wardani bisa terpenuhi. Dengan semangat tanpa lelah setiap hari wardani pergi keladang memberi minum dan makan sapi peliharaannya. Dengan membawa rumput yang sudah disabit kemarin sore,oleh suaminya.Mereka saling bekerjasama dalam menjalani usaha ini.juga kedua anak mereka kadang yang bergantian untuk memberi makan.Satu sapi memang sudah dimiliki sejak 2 tahun.yang satu baru dibeli karena mendapat modal pinjaman,Seharga Rp 4.500.000,-sisa uang digunakan untuk membeli pakan untuk kedua sapinya.Usaha ini sangat cocok dan sudah kelihatan hasilnya,satu induk sapi wardani sementara ini mengandung.Berarti Keuntungannya akan bertambah.Walaupun rumah mereka sangat sederhana terbuat dari Gedeg tetapi tidak menjadi beban bagi keluarga mereka.Bahkan mereka bertekad dengan keuntungan usaha sapi, mereka akan bisa membangun rumah.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed and breeding/ female cow (Membeli pakan dan Induk sapi)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suweni

texts.id:
Suweni lives a simple life. She lives in a house built of dried leaves. She inherited a small field from her parent that is being use to farm cacao. She has 3 children. All of them married and they live in on their own. This small cacao farm is her only source of income.

She can sell dried cacao up to IDR 100 thousand (around USD 11). Her customers are usually come to her house to make pick up.

She wants to improve her revenue so she can save some of the money to enable her to build her simple house.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Kebun coklat yang dimiliki oleh ketut suweni memang tidak begitu luas.Tetapi kebun inilah yang menjadi penghasilan utama bagi suweni.Letak kebun suweni tidak jauh dari pekarangan rumannya,sehingga dengan mudah suweni bisa merawat kebunnya.Setiap hari suweni membersihkan batang yang sudah kering.Dalam satu minggu Suweni bisa menjual biji coklat yang sudah kering sebesar Rp.100.000,- Hasil penjualan ini cukup untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari.Biasanya sudah ada pelanggan yang datang untuk membeli biji coklat yang sudah kering.Tiga orang anak yang dimilki sudah menikah dan sudah tinggal masing-masing dengan keluarga mereka.rumah suweni sangat sederhana terbuat dari gedeg.tetapi dengan usaha kebun warisan yang diberikan oleh orang tua mereka,sudah cukup untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari yang sederhana.Untuk kedepannya keuntungan yang didapat akan disisihkan untuk bisa membangun rumah mereka.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer (Membeli pupuk)

loans.name: Ni Kadek Ariani

texts.id:
Ariani is just married. Her husband is a seasonal farm worker who does not have a permanent income. Therefore she wants to help her husband by earning extra income to support her new family.

She bought 2 piglets from her relative. She feeds them everyday at 09.00 am. She can earn up to IDR 800 thousand for a 6 month period (around USD 91). She wants to use this money to buy more piglets so her business can grow more.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Setiap pukul 09:00 wita Ariani memberi 2 ekor babi peliharaannya. Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya. Kandang bambu yang sederhana dimiliki dibelakang rumah,sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimilki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai bapak kepala rumah tangga. Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani yang tidak menentu.Kebetulan Ariani baru saja menikah dan baru memulai belajar berusaha.Babi penggemukan yang dipelihara dibeli dari saudaranya.Keuntungan yang diterima dalam 6 bulan sebesar Rp.800.000,- keuntungan ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit lagi agar usaha babinya semakin berkembang.

loans.use: To buy pig feed (Membeli pakan)

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wenji

texts.id:
Mekepung is one of Balinese traditional sport where two bulls race as a team against the others. Wayan Wenji is raising bull for Mekepung events. Wenji's bull business is quite successful as her bulls are favored by the local community in their neighborhood at Jembrana.

There are customers who rent for Wenji's bulls for Mekepung event. In a 6 month period Wenji can earn rent money of IDR 500 thousand (around USD 55). Wenji's bulls win Mekepung quite often. Usually once the bulls are old enough to be sold, Wenji can sell them for IDR 10 million (around USD 1,100).

She uses the money to finance her family daily needs and also to buy another bull to be raised as racers.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Tradisi Bali yang sudah lasim didengar ialah kata mekepung.Langsung teringat dengan kerbau.Artinya sepasang kerbau yang kuat lari untuk bisa memenagkan lawan lainnya.Wayan Wenji menjadikan kerbau peliharaannya bibit yang bisa dipakai untuk mekepung.Wenji menjadikan Usaha yang sangat maju.Karena Kerbau penggemukan yang dipelihara sangat banyak diminati oleh masyarakat jembrana.Setiap harinya kebau peliharaannya diberimakan rumput gajah.Juga diberi dedak.pada siang hari biasanya 2 kerbau diajak ketempat kali dibelakang rumahnya.agar tidak kepanasan.Wenji dan suami saling bantu dalam usaha ini.Dalam 6 bulan biasanya,ada saja yang menyewa kerbau ini,untuk dibawa lomba.kerap kali menang dan disewa Rp.500.000.-Biasanya bila sudah besar kerbau ini sudah ada yang mesan dan dibeli dengan Harga Rp,10.000.000. Keuntungan yang diterima biasanya dugunakan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari dan untuk membeli bibit lagi.untuk kedepannya Wenji ingin bisa memelihara lebih banyak agar bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih.

loans.use: To buy bull feed (Membeli pakan)

loans.name: Samsuri

texts.id:
Samsuri is a widower without any children. He lives in a very poor house rent from his friend in Tukadaya that should be paid Rp 500,000.00 a year. He should work hard to fulfill his daily need. Fortunately Samsuri has the skill to weave “bede”. He uses the skill to make money. With Rp 500,000.00 for initial capital, Samsuri buys bamboo from his neighbor and sometimes from other village. “bede” that he produced are usually bought by his surrounding neighbor. “bede” that made of bamboo skin is sold Rp 225,000 – Rp 250,000 a piece, and “bede” made of bamboo sold Rp150,000 – Rp 175,000 a piece. With limited capital, Samsuri would not earn much. That’s why Samsuri wants to propose loan from Dinari to enable him to purchase more bamboo so that he could be able to earn more. If he could earn more money, he wish to be able to buy his own house

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Samsuri hidup sebagai seorang duda tanpa istri maupun anak. Samsuri tinggal disebuah rumah sangat sederhana, yang disewa dari seorang temannya di Tukadaya. Dan setiap tahun harus membayar sewa rumah sebesar Rp.500.000, makanya Samsuri harus bekerja keras untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Untungnya Samsuri memiliki ketrampilan menganyam bede, sehingga usaha ini ia teruskan untuk bisa menyambung hidup. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.500.000,Samsuri membeli bambu pada masyarakat sekitar,atau kadang-kadang kepelosok desa. Biasanya bede yang dihasilkan dibeli oleh masyakarat dari wilayah sekitar . Satu lembar bede yang terbuat dari kulit bambu dijual seharga Rp.225.000 sampai Rp.250.000,sedangkan kalau dari perut bambu dijual seharga Rp.150.000 Sampai Rp.175.000/lembar. Dengan modal yang sedikit ,keuntungan yang didapat tentunya sedikit pula, Oleh sebab itu Samsuri ingin mengembangkan usahanya ini,kebetulan sekarang pesanan sedang banyak, makanya ia mengajukan pinjaman kepada Dinari untuk bisa membeli bambu yang lebih banyak,dengan harapan keuntungan yang didapat akan meningkat dan Samsuri juga sangat berharap dari keuntungan itu sedikit demi sedikit bisa menabung dan nantinya bisa memiliki rumah sendiri walaupun sederhana.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Luh Yoga Semadi

texts.id:
As a wife of a small worker, Ni Luh Yoga Semadi is required to be able to help her husband to fulfill their daily needs. Traditional textile weaving business, which is a heritage from her mother is the choice, because by doing it, she is still able to do all housewife activities and raise her two children. Ni Luh Yoga Semadi has been working on traditional textile weaving quite long, even since before she got married, but she still could not able to earn maximum income. She start from weaved a piece of cloth, and continue to do more and more. She usually sells her weaving products to nearest stores and sometimes she works on orders from customers. She purchases yearn and printing materials from Nagari market. Ni Luh Yoga Semadi receives more orders on Galungan and Kuningan halidays that sometimes she could not be able to fulfill other orders. The limited capital only enables her to fulfill her family daily needs, which is Rp 15,000 a day. Fortunately they live in their own house that they do not have to pay rental fee. Now Ni Luh Yoga Semadi is very thankful for she could earn loan from Dinari Foundation to increase her capital that enable her to produce more waeving products according to orders she received from stores and others. She wish the income she earns will be more that she hopes she will be able to give as highest education for her children, and to fulfill their daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai istri dari suami yang berprofesi sebagai Pegawai rendahan , Ni Luh Yoga Semadi dituntut untuk mampu membantu suami dalam hal menambah pendapatan keluarga. Usaha Tenun kain tradisional merupakan pilihan hidup yang dijalani dan juga merupakan usaha turun temurun yang diwariskan oleh ibu kandungnya, karena dengan usaha itu ia masih dapat mengerjakan semua aktifitas sebagai ibu rumah tangga sekaligus mengasuh kedua orang anaknya. Usaha tenun kain sudah lama dia tekuni, bahkan sebelum Ni Luh Yoga Semadi menikah sudah bisa mengerjakan usaha ini akan tetapi belum mampu memperoleh hasil yang maksimal. Berawal dari mengerjakan satu lembar kain hingga menjadi banyak. Hasil tenun kainnya biasanya disetor ketoko-toko atau membuat sesuai pesanan masyarat lainnya.Sedangkan bahan seperti benang dan sablonan lainnya dibeli dari pasar Negara. Biasanya pesanan akan ramai menjelang hari raya Galungan dan Kuningan . Sehingga Ni Luh Yoga Semadi menjadi kekurangan modal dan tidak bisa melayani pesanan sesuai dengan keinginan masyarakat. Sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari –hari,karena setiap hari Ni Luh Yoga Semadi harus mengeluarkan biaya sebesar Rp.15.000, untungnya rumah yang ditempati merupakan milik pribadi sehingga tidak perlu mengeluarkan biaya untuk sewa rumah.Tetapi sekarang Ni Luh Yoga Semadi sangat bersyukur karena telah mendapat pinjaman dana dari yayasan Dinari untuk menambah modal usahanya. Sehingga Ni Luh Yoga Semadi bisa membuat tenunan kain lebih banyak dan sesuai dengan pesanan dari toko-toko maupun masyarakat langsung dengan berbagai macam warna dan corak,dengan harapan keuntungan yang didapat menjadi lebih banyak sehingga nantinya Ni Luh Yoga Semadi dapat menyekolahkan kedua anaknya ketingkat yang lebih tinggi, dan dapat memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for traditional weaving production

loans.name: Sayu Putu Narmi

texts.id:
Income of a farmer is not certain. It is not daily or monthly, but depends on the yield resulted. That’s why, Sayu Putu Narmi, a wife of a farmer, is required to help her husband to fulfill their family’s daily needs. She uses her skill to sew that she got before she got married to open a tailor. She deployed Rp 1,000,000 as the initial capital to purchase a sewing machine and several pieces of cloths. She started by sewing “kebaya” and “kamen” as ordered by the customers. With limited capital, Sayu Putu Narmi only earn small income, which can only be used for buying kitchen supplies. Even though they oly have one child, they need more than Rp 20,000 a day for living.

Usually, Sayu Putu Narmi receives more orders before Galungan and Kuningan celebration. She sometimes has to refuse orders because she does not have enough resource to purchase clothes, for the costumer do not want to bring their own, but to purchase from Sayu Putu Narni. Fortunately, Dinari Foundation is willing to help by giving loan that enable Sayu Putu Narni purchase more materials so she is able to provide clothes with various color and printing. With the loan, Sayu Putu Narni hopes that her business can be improved, that she can hope for increased income she can save for her future.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Mempunyai suami petani tentu saja penghasilannya tidak menentu ,karena pengasilan petani tidak bisa setiap hari atau setiap bulan,ini tergantung dari panen berhasil atau tidak.Oleh sebab itu Sayu Putu Narmi dituntut bisa menambah pendapatan keluarga makanya ketrampilan yang dibawanya sebelum menikah bisa diterapkan setelah Sayu Putu Narmi menikah. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.000.000 ,Sayu Putu Narmi memulai usahanya sebagai seorang penjahit,dengan membeli 1 buah mesin jahit dan beberapa lembar kain,ia membuat baju kebaya maupun kamen jadi sesuai dengan pesanan masyarakat. Dengan modal yang sedikit tentu saja keuntungan yang didapat juga sedikit dan itu hanya cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja. Walupun hanya mempunyai satu orang anak ,namun biaya yang dikeluarkan setiap hari cukup banyak yaitu Rp.20.000 hanya untuk dapur saja,belum keperluan yang lainnya. Biasanya usaha Sayu Putu Narmi akan ramai saat menjelang hari raya Galungan dan Kuningan,Sampai ia tidak mampu melayani pelanggan karena kekurangan modal untuk membeli bahan baku seperti kain kebaya atau kamen,karena yang menjahit tidak mau membawa sendiri,dan langsung membeli kain pada Sayu Putu Narmi. Untunglah Yayasan Dinari membantu memberikan pinjaman modal sehingga Sayu Putu Narmi bisa tetap menjalankan usahanya dan sekarang bisa menyediakan kain dalam jumlah yang lebih banyak dengan motif dan warna yang beragam.Dengan pinjaman yang diberikan oleh Yayasan Dinari Sayu Putu Narmi berharap usahanya semakin ramai dan berkembang,sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh menjadi meningkat, karena Sayu Putu Narmi rindu untuk bisa menebung sebagai bekal di hari tua nanti.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and equipments for tailor business

loans.name: Nur Aisah

texts.id:
Nur Aisah is a chicken satay peddler. Everymorning, she buys chicken for her satay in a market nearby, and then cooks them to become seasoned nuggets and saves them in the fridge to be sold on the afternoon. Nur Aisah earns Rp 30,000 a day that she uses to fulfill her daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Nur Aisah adalah penjual sate ayam yang setiap hari menjual dagangannya di dekat rumahnya degan cara berjalan kaki. Bahan-bahan untuk membuat sate ayam didapatkannya dengan berbelanja kepasar setiap paginya, kemudian bahan tersebut diolahnya menjadi potongan daging yang sudah dicampur bumbu, bahan tersebut disimpannya dalam kulkas kemudian dikeluarkan pada saat Nur Aisah akan berjualan yaitu sore hari. Dari hasil jualannya Nur Aisah mendapatkan keuntungan sekitar 30.000 rupiah/hari, dan dari keuntungan itu digunakannya sebagai modal untuk berjualan dan biaya hidup setiap hari.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase raw materials to produce chicken satay

loans.name: Ni Komang Sutarsini

texts.id:
Baliness daily life as Hindunese is full of religion rituals, which is very time consuming, for they have to prepare all ritual materials. Therefore, many of Hindunese prefer to buy finished products that they do not have to spend time to prepare them. This condition is an opportunity for Ni Komang Sutarsini to produce and snacks as “jajan uli, satuh, and pelpelan” as components of ritual materials. She started her business with Rp 150,000 as the initial capital. The business gives her Rp 125,000 income a week. Even though earns small amount, she is not pessimistic. Ni Komang Sutarsini manages her business diligently to help her husband who is a truck driver paying their two children tuition fees with a hope seeing their bright future. Her spirit to see a better life increase her passion in working, even more when she received loan from Dinari to increase her production by purchasing more materials to produce more snacks.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Kehidupan masyarakat di Bali yang dominan beragama Hindu sangat disibukkan oleh upacara keagamaan yang menyita banyak waktu, karena mereka harus mempersiapkan segala macam sarana upacara. Untuk menyiasati hal ini kebanyakan dari mereka memilih untuk mengadakan segala sarana ritual tersebut dengan membeli yang sudah jadi sehingga tidak perlu membuat lagi. Hal inilah yang membuat Ni Komang Sutarsini melihat peluang yang besar dalam usaha produksi jajanan seperti: jajan uli, satuh, pelpelan (rengginang) yang juga termasuk salah satu bagian dari sarana ritual tersebut. Memulai usaha dengan modal Rp 150.000,- setiap minggunya usaha produksi jajan ini memberikan keuntungan Rp 125.000,-. Walaupun keuntungan yang diperolehnya tidak banyak namun hal ini tidak membuatnya berkecil hati. Dengan tekun usaha ini dikelolanya untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk pasir, menyekolahkan kedua anak mereka supaya bisa sukses dan memiliki masa depan yang cerah. Keinginannya untuk bisa hidup lebih baik membuatnya tambah semangat apalagi setelah mendapat pinjaman modal usaha dari DINARI yang kemudian dipergunakan untuk meningkatkan omzetnya dengan membeli bahan baku dan produksi jajan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (flour, sugar) and equipments to produce snacks

loans.name: Nurul Masita

texts.id:
Nurul Masita sells various delicacies like cookies and small cakes that are individually wrapped. The ingredients are purchased in Kerobokan Market in the evening. Then those ingredients are cooked the next morning. She then delivers the finished products to local kiosks around her home and local market. Nurul's husband works as a contract construction labor who earns about $40 per week if he has work. Nurul has two children, one in middle school and another in grade school. The earnings from her business is used to pay for her children's school tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Nurul Masita mempunyai usaha berjualan jajanan basah seperti kue-kue dan makanan siap saji yang sudah dibungkus dengan kertas makanan. Bahan-bahan untuk membuat makanan diperolehnya dari pasar Kerobokan pada waktu sore hari, kemudian bahan-bahan tersebut diolahnya pada pukul 05.00 pagi hari. Setelah semua masakan telah siap jajanan basah dan makanan siap saji tersebut di antar ke warung-warung yang ada di sekitar rumah Nurul dan sebagian lagi di jual di pasar Kerobokan. Nurul mempunyai suami yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan yang berpenghasilan 350.000 rupiah/minggu dan itu didapat jikalau ada proyek bangunan yang harus dikerjakan. Nurul mempunyai dua orang anak yang sedang bersekolah di SMP dan Sekolah Dasar, usahanya sebagai penjual jajanan basah dan makanan siap saji untuk menopang biaya sekolah anak-anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Ingredients

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Kade Gunar

texts.id:
I

Gusti Ayu Kade Gunarsih is no stranger to busy life. She is married with three children. As her kids grow, they needs less taking care of, therefore she has more spare time for side activities. To fill her spare time, she started a small kiosk by renting a spot near her home with starting funds of $120, and she can earn up to $3.5 to $4.5 daily. After the rent contract was over, she moved the business to her home as she felt it was more practical. Now one of her child has finished school while the other two are still in school so she still has a lot of tuition to pay for.

As her business grows, her clients are demanding her to carry more variety of goods. She wants to increase her offering. She started her business by only selling light snacks and soft drinks, now she wants to carry other household goods such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. However, she does not have enough fund. She hopes DINARI loan may help her expand her business and earn more profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Kegiatan sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang selalu sibuk mengurus suami dan tiga orang anak membuat Gusti Ayu Kade Gunarsih terbiasa dengan kehidupan yang dipenuhi kesibukan. Kemudian seiring dengan bertambahnya usia anak-anaknya, kesibukannyapun semakin berkurang, sehingga banyak waktu yang dimilikinya untuk kegiatan lainnya. Untuk mengisi waktu luangnya Gusti Ayu Kade Gunarsih membuka warung kecil dengan menyewa sebuah tempat di dekat rumahnya dengan modal awal Rp 1.000.000,- dan keuntungan yang bisa diperolehnya berkisar Rp. 30.000,- sampai Rp. 40.000,- per hari. Setelah masa sewa tempat berakhir Gusti Ayu Kade Gunarsih memindahkan usahanya ke rumahnya karena dirasanya lebih mudah dalam pengelolaannya. Kini setelah satu anaknya menyelesaikan pendidikannya tinggal dua orang anaknya yang masih bersekolah menjadi tanggungannya bersama dengan suaminya. Semakin hari usahanya mulai berkembang dan dirasanya kebutuhan masyarakat disekitarnya semakin bertambah. Niatnya adalah menambah jenis dagangannya yang semula berupa makanan dan minuman ringan dan beberapa jenis kebutuhan rumah tangga dengan menjual kebutuhan pokok seperti beras, minyak, gula dan sebagainya namun modal yang dimiliki tidak mencukupi. Kemudian ada bantuan pinjaman yang diperolehnya dari DINARI dan ini membuatnya bersemangat dalam mengelola usahanya karena omzet penjualanyapun tentu akan bertambah

loans.use: Additional funding to purchase inventory

loans.name: Sugiri

texts.id:
Sugiri is a roaming fruit vendor. He sells bananas, salak and oranges that has been packed in small batches to be sold in local kiosks, that are mostly his regular clients. He buys those fruits in bulk from the local market, then packed in smaller batches. Each day, Sugiri can earn about $7 profit. He uses the earnings for daily living expenses and to pay is two kids' tuition. He wants to improve his business and family's finances. He and his wife dreams that his kids wil finish school all the way.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sugiri adalah seorang pedagang buah yang setiap hari berkeliling dengan sepeda motornya, buah yang dijualnya adalah pisang, salak dan jeruk yang sudah dibungkus-bungkus untuk dijual di warung-warung yang sebagian adalah para langganan Sugiri. Buah-buah yang dijual Sugiri didapatkannya dari pasar buah yang dibelinya dengan jumlah yang banyak kemudian dibungkus. Dalam sehari Sugiri mendapatkan keuntungan sekitar 60.000 rupiah/hari, yang dipakai untuk biaya hidup setiap hari serta membiayai kedua anaknya yang masih kecil dan sekolah. Keinginan untuk menjadikan hidup lebih baik merupakan harapan dari Sugiri bersama keluarga, bisa membesarkan dan menyekolahkan anak merupakan mimpi dari setiap orangtua seperti Sugiri.

loans.use: Fund to Buy Fruits to be resold

loans.name: Eldar

texts.ru:
Eldar K. was born in 1982 in Agsu, where he still lives. This is the sixth year in a row he has been working in his phone repair business. He is married and has one child. Last year, Eldar applied for a loan from Normicro's Agsu branch. He plans to use the money to repair his store.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримов Эльдар 1982 года рождения. Родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. Шестой год подряд работает в этой сфере. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Прошлом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Взяв кредит Эльдар хочеть сделат ремонт в магазине.

loans.use: To repair his shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Chahangir

texts.ru:
Chahangir M. was born in 1956. He lives in Agsu city. He is married and has four children Chahangir has been in the trading business for the past thirteen years. He has a large family and therefore, he has to work will all the strength he has. He applied for a loan at Normicro two years ago. Now, he returned for a new loan. Chahangir would like to purchase new equipment.

Джахангир Мустафаев 1956 года рождения. Проживает в городе Ахсу. Женат , имеет четверых детей. В торговли более тринадцати лет. Семья болшая, по этому ему приходится работат со всеми усилиями. Первый раз взял кредит в Нормикро Ахсуниского филиала два года тому назад. Теперь обратился еще раз. Он хочеть оборудовать свой магазин.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Mutiah

texts.id:
Mutiah is married to a construction worker who has uncertain income. Sometimes, her husband can lay idle for some time. Mutiah started a small food kiosk that sells foods that she made herself. She starts her day at 5 am to purchase ingredient at the market with the help of her husband. After that she starts cooking, again with the help of her husband to prepare spices. Mutiah has a 9 month old daughter. This business is barely enough to cover daily living expenses with $80 profit per week. Mutiah hopes that DINARI loan can help her increase her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Mempunyai seorang suami sebagai pekerja buruh bangunan membuat Mutiah tidak tinggal diam, karena suaminya bisa bekerja jika ada proyek yang sedang berlangsung dan jika proyek selesai maka suaminya harus menunggu untuk proyek yang berikutnya. Mutiah membuat warung makan yang sangat sederhana dengan menjual makanan-makanan yang diolahnya sendiri. Mulai dari pukul 05.00 pagi Mutiah belanja kepasar yang diantar oleh suaminya, begitu juga dengan memasak makanan tersebut suaminya dengan setia membantu Mutiah dalam mempersiapkan bumbu-bumbunya. Mutiah mempunyai seorang anak perempuan yang masih sangat kecil dengan usia 9 bulan. Usaha yang dijalaninya mampu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya dengan keuntungan 750.000 rupiah/minggu. Mutiah berharap dengan modal yang diberikan oleh DINARI mampu meningkatkan usahanya untuk lebih maju lagi.

loans.use: Purchase Ingredients

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 48 years old. He has 4 children. Two of them are studying in university and the others are studying in school. He has a welding shop. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new welding machine and some iron. He also wants to renovate the shop and make some advertising in order to increase his income and develop his project. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new welding machine and some iron

loans.name: Mayis

texts.ru:
Mayis Q. was born in 1959 in Agsu, where he still lives. He is married. For more than thirty years, he has been working as a tailor. He is a wonderful craftsman. This year, Mayis applied for loan from the Agsu branch of Normicro. He would like to buy new equipment.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиев Маис родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. 1959 года рождения. Женат. Более тридцати лет работает портнойом. Прекрасный мастер. Маис в этом году обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал чтобы получить кредит. Он хочеть купить нового оборудование.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: Laila Romelah

texts.id:
Laila Romelah sells cooking spice made of ingredients such as shallots, garlic, chili, onions, etc. These spices are bought in bulk and then packed in 1 kg batches. Each pack is sold in local kiosk in Laila's neighborhood, around Kebo Iwa road. She can earn up to $4.50 profit daily. This profit is used for daily living expenses and saved for her future and her kids' tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Laila Romelah berprofesi sebagai pedagang bumbu dapur, seperti bawang merah, bawang putih, lombok, bombay dan bumbu-bumbu lainnya. Bumbu-bumbu tersebut dibelinya dengan jumlah yang banyak, yang kemudian di bungkus dengan plastik dan tiap plastiknya berukuran 1 kilo. Bungkusan bumbu-bumbu tersebut di jual di warung-warung yang berlokasi di sekitar tempat tinggal Laila Romelah yaitu dijalan Kebo Iwa. Dalam sehari Laila dapat meraup keuntungan sekitar 40.000 rupiah. Keuntungan tersebut dipakai untuk biaya hidup setiap hari dan di tabung untuk modal usaha berikutnya serta biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Ingredients for Spice Mix

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy a car

loans.name: Stage Hera Kende Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Solomon has been in the business of buying second-hand clothing in bulk and retailing the same. He is married with 4 children who are all school-going. He buys the clothes in bulk from Nairobi and transports them to Kisumu for retailing. He has been in this business for over 5 years now. One of his primary motivations for choosing this business is because of the readily available market due to the high poverty levels in Kisumu town.

He buys his stock every 2 weeks and sells the clothing not only in Kisumu Town but also in neighboring markets on the outskirts of Kisumu. He goes to these markets on their specific market days.

The post-election violence in Kisumu Town affected him negatively as it meant he couldn’t sell his clothes for quite sometime. There was, however, an opportunity for him as well in this situation since most people now can’t afford to buy new clothes and have to rely on second-hand clothes for survival. He hopes to take advantage of this opportunity by taking a refinanced loan to enable him to carry on with his earlier business. His business had been making profits before the violence enabling him to frequently restock his business and pay his loan as well. His loan repayments have been on schedule and so have been the group repayments.

He has been the secretary for his group and has done a good job particularly in ensuring that the group has its loan balances kept intact. The group has also been cohesive and with good repayment rates before the post-election violence. They see the refinancing as an opportunity to get back to their normal business state as soon as possible.

In addition to being cohesive, the group has had good repayment rates in earlier loans and have been having timely meeting on their rescheduled meeting days. Solomon, in addition to his secretarial duties, has played a huge role in energizing the group through constant faith-based encouragements during the violence period.

Disclaimer: Kiva is working with OI-WEDCO to refinance businesses disrupted by Kenya's post-election violence. The group above has received loans from OI-WEDCO in the past and is now working to rebuild their businesses and to get back on their feet. Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To reconstruct and expand businesses after post-election violence

payments.comment:
Dear Lender,

Stage Hera Kende Self-Help Group has repaid $343 of its loan to Kiva lenders.  It is now 10% complete in its repayment schedule.

Sincerely,
Opportunity International WEDCO

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim H., age 25, is married with one child and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She works as a house wife cooking meals and looking after her child. Her husband, Mr. Prom Samech, meanwhile, works as a motor-taxi driver. The majority of his passengers are based near historical temples and other tourist sites. Normally, he can earn on average around $5 each day (excluding gasoline).

This amount of net income is provided to cover all his family’s expenses. Mrs. Sim H. and her husband would like to request a loan in order to purchase a passenger cart that can be attached to his motor-bike to convert as a Tuk-Tuk ( a passenger cart attached with a motor-bike). This would enable him to transport many more passengers than he currently can. This will increase their family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a passenger cart attached with his motor-bike to convert as a Tuk-Tuk ( a passenger cart attached with a motor-bike)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S., age 38, is a widow and has two children. One child is enrolled in school and the other one works with her in a grocery shop. Mrs. Heng Sopha has a grocery shop to service to the people in her community. She can typically earn on average around $5 each day of income.

After hearing about CREDIT MFI from her neighbors, Mrs. Heng S. would like to take out a loan to expand her inventory in order to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To expand her inventory in order to meet her growing customer demand.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

texts.en:

She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mil

texts.en:
Mrs. Mil N., age 40, is married with seven children. Five of her children are students and the other two are too young to attend school. Mrs. Mil N. wishes to raise her standard of living by making Khmer noodles and selling to the people near a military barrack. She can earn typically around $2.50 each day in revenue.

Her husband works in the barrack and usually earns about $4 per day. Mrs. Mil N. would like to apply for a loan to reinvest in her business and to repair her house.

loans.use: To reinvest business and repair her house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

texts.en:
Zainabu is 47 years old and is a married woman with 6 children, ranging in age from 8 to 20 years old. Zainabu owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng M., age 37, has divorced since her child was two years old. Now, she lives with her 10-year-old child who studies at a primary school. She runs a grocery store at home, selling provision of food and household stuffs to the people in her community. She makes on average around $20 each day of income.

In order to meet her growing customer needs, Mrs. Heng M. has recently applied for a loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory. She believes this will increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem C. is 35 years old and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She sells sugar cane juice and porridge to the people in her area; she makes an average of around $10 each day in income.

She has four children, two of whom work with at her food store and the others who are still in school. Mrs. Chem C. needs a loan to purchase an electrical sugar cane grinder to facilitate her business. This will give her an opportunity to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical sugar cane grinder to facilitate her business.

Anna is 23 years old and is a married woman with 1 child who is 8 months old. She owns a small video library which she started in 2005. Every day, Anna works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

Felista is 25 years old and is a single woman. She is a clothing seller who started in this line of work in 2003. Every day, Felista works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

Zainabu is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 15. Zainabu is a cloth seller who started out in this line of work in 2000. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

Habiba is 40 years old and is a divorced mother with 4 children, ranging in age from 11 to 21 years old. Habiba owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 6am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $195 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 46 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages19 and 23 years old. Adelina owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business and to do some renovations on her store.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is 32 years old and is a widow with 4 children, ranging in age from 3 to 14. Aysha is a cloth seller, a business she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mouna Market 2010-2-2 Group

texts.en:
