The group leader of this small group is Santina J.. She is currently in the business of selling at the hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Santina is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 12, and her children go to school. Each week, Santina makes approximately 240 sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school.

Santina is joined in her small group by Charity J., Joice P., Amelida Sande, and Rebbecca D.. Charity J. has a business in selling breads and wants to buy a car. Joice P. is currently operating a business in brewing alcohol and wants a loan to expand the bar. Amelida Sande operates a business of selling vegetable and wants to expand the business. Rebbecca D. is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Camp Kuku 2008-3 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lucia J.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Lucia is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children ranging from age 12 to 18, and her children go to school.

Each week, Lucia makes approximately 315 sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to continue to send her children to school.

Lucia is joined in her small group by Juan M., Victoria K., Victoria D., and Agnes K.. Juan M. has a business in selling breads. Victoria K. is also currently operating a business selling breads. Victoria D. operates a business selling vegetables. Agnes K. is currently in the business of selling flour. Each entrepreneur wants to expand her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Zuhura's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is 39 years old and is a widow with 3 children, ages 18, 21, and 24. Zuhura sells clothes and owns a small food vendor store, businesses she started in 1993. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sharifa and Fatuma, who also have businesses dealing in retail sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Devota's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Devota is 32 years old and is a married woman with one child, 11 years old. Devota is a cloth and charcoal seller, a business she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Subira and Mariam, who have businesses dealing in bolt and nut oil sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Fatuma's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 19 years old and is a single woman. She owns a small salon, which she started in 2007. Every day, Fatuma works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her hairdressing services.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Maua, who has a business dealing in retail sales.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mariam's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 46 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 12-28 years old. Mariam owns a small food vendor store and she sells clothes (Vitenge and Khanga, African garments similar to sarongs), a business which she started in 1980. Every day, she works from 6am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending and cloth selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 37 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 2 and 14 years old. Zainabu is a cereals seller, a business she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Advija

texts.en: Advija, a widow and the mother of 13-year-old twins, was born in 1963 and lives in Hlapčevići, a small village near the town of Visoko.  She and her mother together receive a monthly pension of 560 KM.  Advija will use this loan in the amount of $825 to buy chickens in order to expand the existing business and help her family with additional income.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens.

loans.name: Hawa's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Hawa is 30 years old and is a single parent with 2 children, ages 7 and 10 years old. Hawa is a soft drink seller, a business she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cosmetics sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mediha

texts.en: Mediha is a 53-year-old widow from Hlapčevići, a small village near the town of Visoko.  She has three children ranging in age from 28 to 32 years, but  her only income is a monthly pension of 283 KM.  She is making her first loan request from MCO WWI in the amount of $825 in order to purchase a calf.  Mediha thereby hopes to develop additional income for her four-member family, since her pension is not adequate to meet their needs.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Ramiza

texts.en: Ramiza was born in 1972 and is the mother of two children.  Her husband is a construction worker earning a monthly salary of 500,00KM, and they receive additional money from the humanitarian organization “Amica” in the amount of 120,00KM. Ramiza is involved in cattle-breeding and agriculture, but in order to increase income and improve the family’s living standard, she is requesting a loan of $975 to diversify through the purchase of chickens and bee hives.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and bee hives.

loans.name: Janeth's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 24 years old and is a married woman with one child of 2 years old. Janeth sells soap and clothing, a business she started in 2005. Every day, she works till 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $185 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Yusta, who has a business dealing in food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Asha's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Asha is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 14 and 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 15 years old. Asha owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rhoda, who also has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hasiba

texts.en:
Hasiba, born in 1971, is married to a construction worker whose monthly salary is 600,00KM. The K.s have four children, entitling them to a monthly child allowance of 160KM, and  they derive additional income from agriculture and poultry.
In order to improve the family’s financial situation, Hasiba wants to use this first loan in the amount of $975 to buy sheep.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: María Bernalda

texts.en:
María Bernalda is 45 years old, and she and her husband have two sons and one daughter, all of whom attend school. Her husband is an accountant and works for a private company. María Bernalda has been running a clothing store for 16 years. She says that her business helps her supplement the family's income, and she helps her husband support the children's studies. Bernalda also explains that through her business, she has been able to contribute to repairing her house.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy a large range of products to add to her stock. That way, she'll be able to increase her sales volume and thus her income.

loans.use: To supply a small clothing store

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Kadidiatou G. is a mother who is responsible for her seven children and two girls. She sells food items: palm oil, vegetables, and peanut butter in the Diaobé marketplace. Her income enables her to support her family. Kadidiatou is a loyal customer and is exemplary within her group. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Kadidiatou G. est une mère qui a à sa charge ses 07 enfants et 02 fillettes, Elle vend des produits alimentaires ; huile de palme, légumes et pâte d’arachide au niveau du marché de Diaobé. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Kadidiatou est une cliente fidèle et un modèle au niveau de son groupe. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, vegetables, and peanuts

loans.name: Salama's Sisikwasisi Group

texts.en:
Salama is 21 years old and is a single woman. Salama is a batik maker, a business she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in maize and flour sales and cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her  business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Šemsa

texts.en: Šemsa, born in 1965, has two children, ages 11 and 12.  Her husband receives a monthly pension of 280,00KM, and the provision of nursing care earns the family an additional 500,00KM per month. In order to increase household income and expand the products she offers, Šemsa is requesting a loan of $500 to buy new column molds to produce a variety of decorating forms.

loans.use: To buy column molds.

loans.name: Khadija's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Khadija is 32 years old and is a single woman who owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day, Khadija works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Tatu, who also has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ireny

texts.en:
Ireny is 30 years old and the mother of two sons, ages 7 and 8. For seven years, she has been operating a beauty parlor in the Itabo community of San Cristobal. Ireny has acquired a lot of experience through this long time of offering her services to people of her community. She offers services of manicure, pedicure, haircut, hair straightening, nail cut and the like.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy more products to keep operating her business and attending to her customers. Ireny hopes that her business can continue growing so that she becomes the most famous beauty parlor owner in her community.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of products for a beauty parlor

loans.name: Farzada

texts.en: Farzada was born in 1969 and is the widowed mother of a12-year-old son. Her monthly salary is 460,00KM, while her son earns 70,00KM monthly. Farzada wants to use her first loan in the amount of $500 to purchase both chicken feed and additional chickens in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Dafrosa's Group

texts.en:
Dafrosa is 50 years old and is divorced with 4 children, ranging in age from 24 to 35 years old. Dafrosa is a food seller, a business she started in 1994. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Husna, who has a business dealing in curtain sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Džemila

texts.en: Džemila, a 52-year- old mother of  three children, two daughters and one son, is from Gradačac. She and her husband, who is awaiting a pension, are involved in agriculture and fruit-growing. This is their third loan from MCO WWI in the amount of  $500, and Džemila will use it for cultivation and maintenance of her orchard.

loans.use: For cultivation and orchard maintenance.

loans.name: Maimuna's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Maimuna is 46 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ranging in age from 14 to 25 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 18. Maimuna owns a small food vendor store and she also does embroidery of bedsheets, which she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $345 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatuma, who has a business dealing in shoe sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her businesss

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Dia

texts.en:
Dia is a married woman with 3 children, ranging in age from 14 to 20 years old. Dia owns a small food vendor store which she started in 1988. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sia's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Sia is 28 years old and is a married woman with one child who is 1 year old. Sia owns a small stationery store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $275 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Doreen, who has a business dealing in cloth sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is widow with 2 children, ages 9 and 6 years old. She is a cloth seller who started her business in 2000. Every day, Rehema works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is widow woman with 2 children, ages 9 and 6 years old. Rehema is cloth seller, she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana, an entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, in western Ukraine, is the married mother of a two-year-old child. She has a small children’s clothing business, located in a large supermarket, which she has operated for three years, and currently makes around $300-$500 in profit per month. To encourage parents to have more children, the Ukrainian government has set up a financial incentive program where families are given support for each child from pre-birth to three years old. This program benefits entrepreneurs like Oksana who provide child-related products, as parents are able to spend more money caring for their children.

Oksana has requested a loan to purchase new inventory for her store. This will help her to continue making a good profit and work towards her goal of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Uriy

texts.en:
Uriy is a business owner from Beregovo, Ukraine. He has a small store where he sells a large assortment of child care products – from diapers and baby food to lotions, bath supplies and specialized laundry detergents. Uriy has been in business for about two years. He has an excellent location and carries items that are in demand. He currently makes around $1000 to $1200 per month – a good income for both him and his wife, Oksana.

Uriy has requested a short term loan to purchase additional inventory, which will enable him to increase his sales and earn a higher profit. We are happy to have the opportunity to support Uriy in his business endeavors and look forward to his continued success.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
The Mujeres Unidas de Ciudad del Este committee is comprised of enterprising women, who in addition to being homemakers, wives, and mothers, are also small business owners, working with the goal of offering their children a better future.

These women carry out several different types of activities in order to generate extra income for the household expenses. There are a total 15 members in the group. The group leader, or General Director as she is called in the program, is Mrs. María Antonieta Ávalos, who sells lottery tickets. The other members are Rafaela S., Carmen C., Marilina V., Maura E., Gregoria P., and Miryan López, who all work in food preparation and sales. Antonia E., Elizabeth B., Antonia Centurión, and Miryan G. sells shoes and apparel. Claudelina Álvarez, Florencia Gómez, and Elisa Cáceres have a general store and a drink shop, respectively. Liliana P. is a cleaning lady.

They are requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise and supplies that will be invested in their businesses, thus allowing them to expand their income through their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité Mujeres Unidas de Ciudad del Este esta compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras, que además de ser amas de casa, esposas y madres, también son microempresarias, llevando todo esto con la única finalidad de dar a sus hijos un mejor porvenir.

Estas mujeres realizan diversos tipos de actividades para poder generar un ingreso extra para el sustento familiar, en total son 15 las integrantes de la misma. La líder del grupo, o Directora General como el programa la llama, es la señora María Antonieta Ávalos, ella se dedica a la venta de loterías, sus demás integrantes son Rafaela S., Carmen C., Marilina V., Maura E., Gregoria P. y Miryan López que se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comidas; Antonia E., Elizabeth B., Antonia Centurión, Miryan G. venden ropas y calzados, Claudelina Álvarez, Florencia Gómez, Elisa Cáceres tiene una despensa y una tienda de ventas de bebidas respectivamente y Liliana P. es limpiadora.

Ellas solicitan el crédito para poder adquirir mercaderías e insumos para invertirlos en sus negocios, de este modo poder expandir sus ingresos en las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing (t-shirts, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes for men/women), basic foodstuff (sugar, milk, eggs, flour, cooking oil, breads, drinks), and household cleaning supplies

loans.name: Roxana Maricela

texts.es:
Roxana Sánchez is a married mother of a 3-year-old daughter. She started her hamburger business 3 years ago in order to help herself with the household expenses, thus improving her quality of life. At that time, she was pregnant and well aware of the impending expenses. Her business has prospered and she has been able to maintain it until now thanks to her dedication.

She now needs a loan of $375.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can expand her business. With your help, Roxana will be able to continue with her business, offering better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Roxana Sánchez es casada y tiene una niña de 3 años. inicio su negocio de venta de hamburguesas hace 3 años para ayudarse en sustento económico y así tener un mejor nivel de vida, ya que en ese momento ella estaba embrazada y estaba conciente de los gastos que se avecinaban, gracias a su dedicación su negocio han prosperado y por eso lo ha conservado.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Roxana podrá continuar su negocio brindándoles mejor servicio a sus clientes

loans.use: Expansion of hamburger business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Mrs. Cristina G. is a married woman whose husband’s name is Antonio Florentín. They have 3 lovely children together, 2 of whom are underage, while the eldest daughter helps out her mother with the business.

Since 1980, Cristina has owned a clothing boutique, which she managed to set up thanks to a pension that she received from a company for which she used to work.

Cristina sells: t-shirts, jeans, shirts, skirts, dresses, and some shoes. Her previous loans have been used to expand her business. However, she now needs a new loan so that she may purchase more merchandise, namely autumn apparel, because her customers have been requesting it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cristina es una mujer casada, su marido se llama Antonio Florentín y ellos son padres de 3 bellos hijos de los cuales 2 son menores y la hija mayor es la que le ayuda a en el negocio a su madre.

Desde 1980 Cristina es dueña de una boutique de ropas, la misma logro montarla gracias a una indemnización cobrada de la empresa donde trabajaba.

Entre las prendas que Cristina vende podemos citar: remeras, jeans, camisas, faldas, vestidos, y algunos calzados. Los créditos anteriores han sido utilizados para ampliar el negocio y hoy solicita uno nuevo para la compra de más mercaderías en especial ropas de la temporada otoño que sus clientes ya le han solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase of jeans, coats, and assorted tops

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Mr. Demetrio A. is married to Mrs. Dalia Primitiva Samudio. They have two underage children together.

He is a barber who from a young age helped his father, who was also a barber. He started his business with the help of his parents, and his hair salon has been in business for 15 years now. He counts on the support of his wife, who is also a hairdresser. They are both moving their business forward, and it has been growing day by day.

Demetrio has managed to gain many customers thanks to his service. He would like to improve his salon, starting with a new styling station and mirror which he will purchase with the help of the loan he is currently requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Demetrio A. esta casado con la señora Dalia Primitiva Samudio, tiene dos hijos menores de edad.

El es peluquero, desde muy pequeño ha ayudado a su padre que también era peluquero. El monto su negocio con el apoyo de sus padres y ya van 15 años que su peluquería esta en funcionamiento. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, ya que también es peluquera, ambos llevan adelante dicho negocio y día a día va creciendo de a poco.

Demetrio ha logrado hacerse de muchos clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece. El desea mejorar su local, empezando por un mueble nuevo con espejo que desea adquirirlo con la ayuda del crédito que solicita.

loans.use: Purchase of styling station with mirror

loans.name: Jorgelina

texts.es:
Jorgelina M. is a 70-year-old widowed mother of 4 children. Mrs. M. owns a general store in the Barrio Las Mercedes neighborhood in Presidente Franco City. This city is located just a few minutes away from downtown Ciudad del Este.

Jorgelina opened the business’ doors in 1994, in the wake of her husband’s passing. She had some money saved, so she decided to invest it in the business since her husband had been the sole provider for the family.

Her sales have helped her support herself. Her business has also helped her keep her mind off the immense pain that she felt due to the loss of her husband.

Jorgelina is requesting this loan so that she can purchase goods in order to increase her stock, such as: dairy products, breads, meats, soft drinks, snacks, etc.

Jorgelina M. es una señora de 70 años, ella es viuda y madre de 4 hijos. La señora Jorgelina es dueña de una despensa en el Barrio Las Mercedes de la Ciudad Pdte. Franco, esta ciudad dista a escasos minutos del centro de Ciudad del Este.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorgelina M. es una señora de 70 años, ella es viuda y madre de 4 hijos. La señora Jorgelina es dueña de una despensa en el Barrio Las Mercedes de la Ciudad Pdte. Franco, esta ciudad dista a escasos minutos del centro de Ciudad del Este.

Desde el año 1994, dicho negocio abrió sus puertas, esto fue a raíz de que su marido falleció; Jorgelina poseía unos pocos ahorros y decidió invertirlos en el negocio ya que su marido era el único que trabajaba y mantenía la familia.

Las ventas de su negocio la han ayudado a mantenerse, y también fue una distracción para el inmenso dolor que sintió con la perdida de su esposo.

Jorgelina solicita hoy un crédito para poder adquirir mercaderías para ampliar su stock, entre ellas: lácteos, panificados, carne, gaseosas, golosinas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Idalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Idalina O. is married to Mr. Alberto Samaniego. Together they have two children.

She has been running a business in her home for 7 years. She and her husband both work to support the family, since her children are still underage. Idalina runs a general store, where she sells all kinds of basic foodstuff, such as herbs, sugar, milk, bread, noodles, canned goods, cleaning supplies, etc. The store has many customers and is well-known in the area because of the owner’s excellent service.

The loan being requested is for the purchase of a freezer, since Idalina needs it in order to keep her products fresh, and to increase her variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Idalina O. esta casada con el señor Alberto Samaniego, tienen dos hijos.

Ella tiene un negocio en su domicilio particular desde hace 7 años y juntos trabajan para el mantenimiento de su familia, ya que sus hijos aún son menores de edad. El negocio que tiene Idalina es una despensa, en donde comercializa todo tipos de insumos de primera necesidad como yerba, azúcar, leche, pan, fideos, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, etc. Tiene mucha clientela y es muy reconocido en la zona por la buena atención de la dueña.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar un congelador ya que necesita para mantener sus productos frescos y también ampliar así la variedad de productos para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase of freezer

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz Adriana Z. A. is 23 years old and was born in Monterrey. She is single and has two children, ages two years and six months.

After her husband moved to the U.S., at first it was so difficult because she was working but also needed to take care of her baby. She decided that a business could be the best option, because she could make some money and care for her baby at the same time.

She is an enterprising woman, so she started selling tacos at her home two years ago. At first she was just selling tacos in the morning, but as time passed by, she became well-known in the neighborhood and her business grew. Recognizing this, she decided to sell tacos in the morning and hamburgers in the evening.

Now she needs $375 in order to buy some tables and chairs. She promises to repay it in four months. The tables and chairs will help her to sell more and she will become a more successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Señor José Mercedes P. Ortiz is married to Señora Valeriana Guillen. They have 4 children, all adults living independently.

José is the owner of a telephone kiosk, in which people can make local and international calls at a certain cost per minute. José had previously dedicated himself to construction, doing small jobs as a bricklayer. From what he earned he saved a little with which he started his telephone kiosk in the yard of his house.

As he has his wife's help, he also operates a small fast food stall which also makes a little money. José has received an excellent offer from one of the cellular telephone companies in the country. They offered him a percentage of the profits for the sale of credits for pay-as-you-go cell phones. In Paraguay the cellular companies sell “mini cargas”, or “mini-loaders”, which permit pre-payments for calls and messages that can be bought in increments starting at 5.000 Guaraníes, or approximately $1 USD.

The loan he is asking for will buy the cell phone “mini-loader” and so will allow increased sales, specifically with the cell phone company called Tigo.

José has his own house, and his next investment is to replace his roof, using roofing tiles of good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Jose Mercedes P. Ortiz esta casado con la señora Valeriana Guillen, tienen 4 hijos todos mayores de edad que ya viven en forma independiente.

El señor Jose es dueño de una cabina telefónica, en donde las personas pueden realizar llamadas locales e internacionales a razón de un costo por minuto. José se dedicaba anteriormente a la construcción, realizaba pequeñas construcciones como albañil, y con lo que ganaba fue ahorrando de a poco con lo cual pudo habilitar su cabina telefónica en el predio de su casa.

Como tiene el apoyo de su esposa también monto un pequeño copetín el cual también le genera una pequeña ganancia. José ha recibido una buena oferta de una de las empresas de telefonía celular del país, y le ofrecen un porcentaje de ganancias por venta de saldo para celulares, ya que en Paraguay las compañías de celulares venden “mini cargas” que consiste en saldos para llamadas y mensajes que pueden cargarse desde 5.000 guaraníes, aproximadamente $ 1.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar saldo de mini carga telefónica y así tener mayor ingreso en ventas, específicamente de la empresa Tigo.

José tiene su casa propia, y su próxima inversión es cambiar su techo, y colocar tejas de buena calidad.

loans.use: To buy a machine that allows the sale of credits for pay-as-you-go cell phones

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan Ramón T. is a 23-year-old enterprising young man, who is married and lives with his wife and parents. Juan works tailoring and silk-screening school and sports attire.

He opened his business in 2006, after gaining a great deal of experience thanks to the fact that he had been working for a company in this field for many years. Thanks to those years of apprenticeship and saving money, he now works for himself.

Juan says that at a young age, he started working to help his parents with the household expenses. Today, his entire family supports and helps him with the business. His parents are very proud of the great man that he has become, despite his young age. Juan would like to keep expanding his business. He plans to purchase an industrial sewing machine, which will allow him to increase production and fulfill his customers’ orders more speedily.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Ramón T. es un joven emprendedor de 23 años, el esta casado, y vive con su señora en una casa junto con sus padres. Juan se dedica a la confección y serigrafía de atuendos deportivos y escolares.

Desde el año 2006, abrió su propio negocio luego de adquirir mucha experiencia gracias a que trabajo varios años en una empresa que se dedicaba a dicho ramo. Gracias a esos años de aprendizaje y ahorro el hoy día ya trabaja por su cuenta.

Juan dice que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los ingresos de la casa. Hoy toda su familia lo apoya y ayuda con el negocio, sus padres están muy orgullosos del gran hombre que es, a pesar de su corta edad. Juan desea seguir ampliando su negocio, y tiene pensado adquirir una maquina de coser industrial que le permitirá aumentar su producción y cumplir con los pedidos de todos sus clientes con mayor rapidez.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine

loans.name: Buena Ventura

texts.es:
Mr. T. is married to Mrs. Hamma Zalen, with whom he has one son. Buena Ventura owns a tire, paint, and auto body shop that he has been operating at his home since 2006. He has many customers, since his is the only tire shop in the area.

Both parents struggle on a daily basis to move forward, especially now that they have a son, because they want to offer him a better future. The loan being requested is for the purchase of a new air compressor, since the one he currently has is too old.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor esta casado con la señora Hamma Zalen con quien tiene un hijo. Buena Ventura tiene un negocio de gomeria, chapería y pintura en su domicilio particular desde el año 2006, y tiene mucha clientela, ya que es la única gomeria que hay en la zona.

Ambos luchan día a día para salir adelante y mas ahora que tienen su niño, pues desean darle el mejor porvenir. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un compresor nuevo, ya que el que posee esta muy viejo.

loans.use: Purchase of new air compressor

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Señora Maria Eulalia, widow of the late Señor Paez, is an enterprising woman who has had a store in her home for two years. She has many clients and is well known throughout the neighborhood for her good treatment of clients and neighbors.

In her business she sells all types of basic foodstuffs like herbs, flour, oil, sugar, vermicelli, etc. In addition to this, she sells milk and cheese of her own production, as she owns several cows. After a while she decided to take out a loan because she wanted to get started selling pork, but because she didn’t have existing relationships it cost her a lot to acquire her first pigs. Because of this she started to work with the Fundación Paraguaya because it was the only entity that would give her the credit to invest in her business.

Today she is asking for a new loan in order to increase her pig raising business, as the demand for the meat and pork products has increased a lot and as in her area, there isn't anyone else working on this type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Eulalia vda. de Paez es una persona emprendedora, que posee una despensa en su domicilio particular desde hace 2 años, tiene mucha clientela y es muy reconocida en el barrio por el buen trato con sus clientes y vecinos.

En su negocio vende todo tipo de comestibles de primera necesidad como yerba, harina, aceite, azúcar, fideos, etc. Además de ello ella vende leche y queso de su propia producción ya que posee unas vacas. Hace un tiempo ella decidió tomar un crédito pues quería iniciarse en la venta de carne porcina, pero como no poseía referencias anteriores le costo mucho conseguir uno, así fue como empezó a trabajar con Fundación Paraguaya porque fue la única entidad que le otorgo el crédito para invertir en su negocio.

Hoy ella solicita un nuevo crédito para ampliar su cría de cerdos, pues la demanda de la carne y derivados porcinos ha aumentado bastante y en la zona no existe nadie aparte de ella que se dedique a esto.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is married to Pedro, and they have a beautiful baby together. Pedro is a taxi driver who has his own taxi stand in the city’s downtown area.

María is a hairdresser who learned this trade thanks to her parents, who paid for her studies in a renowned institution in the city. She has established a beauty salon with a great number of customers who drop in from Tuesday through Saturday so that she can attend to them.

She is a hardworking person who takes responsibility in her duties. She used the loans that she had previously obtained, which she repaid in a timely manner, for the purchase of beauty supplies. She is now requesting a new loan so that she can expand her business space because she wishes to progress, and to provide a bigger and better area for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada, su marido se llama Pedro y juntos tienen un hermoso bebé. Pedro es taxista y posee su parada en el micro centro de la ciudad.

María es peluquera, ella estudio el oficio gracia a la ayuda de sus padres que pagaron sus estudios en una conocida institución de la ciudad. Hoy día tiene un local formado con una buena cantidad de clientes que de martes a sábados acuden a su local para que ella los atienda.

Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable a sus obligaciones, los créditos que retiro anteriormente los utilizó para la compra de insumos para su peluquería y los ha pagado de forma puntual. Hoy, ella esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para la ampliación de su local ya que desea seguir progresando dar un mayor y mejor espacio para sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his store, specifically in the purchase of wholesale rice

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna C. is an enterprising woman who, like many others in this country, is concurrently a wife, a mother, and a small business owner. Her husband, Darío Sequeira, helps her out with the business. Mirna owns a general store that produces the income needed to support her family, which is comprised of 3 young children who attend elementary school.

They had saved enough money from her husband’s former job, so they started purchasing assorted goods in order to set up the general store. In time, the store kept expanding because it yielded great profits. As the profits increased, so did the stock. The business is located inside the couple’s home, which allows them to save on rent money.

This is an enthusiastic family that has the desire to keep progressing in life. Their biggest wish is to open a mini market, since the area in which they are located is greatly frequented on weekends. They are now requesting a loan in order to invest it in the purchase of goods in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirna C., es una mujer emprendedora como tantas en nuestro país que es esposa, madre y microempresaria a la vez. Su esposo, Darío Sequeira, la ayuda con la atención del negocio. Mirna posee una despensa que le genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener su familia que está compuesta también por tres hijos que aún son pequeños y van a la escuela primaria.

La pareja habían juntado un pequeño capital que lo ahorraron con el anterior trabajo de su marido, con el cual empezaron comprando mercaderías varias para montar la despensa. Con el tiempo fue aumentando y ampliándose ya que las ventas le generaron muy buenas ganancias, fue así que con sus ganancias iban aumentando sucesivamente su stock de mercaderías; el negocio esta ubicado en la propia casa ya que de este modo ahorran en alquiler.

Son familias entusiastas y con ganas de seguir progresando, su mayor ilusión es montar un mini mercado ya que la zona donde se encuentran es muy concurrida los fines de semana. Hoy solicitan el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Purchase of assorted goods such as: rice, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To be able to give more attention to her clients through improvements with her business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Señor Oscar Nicolás Martínez is married to Señora Juana Teodora Torales, and they have one son. Oscar has had a business to repair and maintain electronic equipment since 2006. Over time he has grown his business, gaining customer recognition for the good work he delivers.

With his business, Oscar is the family’s only source of income. He wants to invest some savings in order to start a copetín (a place where fast food is sold) where his wife would take care of selling fast food and soda pop. In addition to the money that they have saved and designated for this, Oscar needs a loan with which they will be able to acquire the utensils and supplies needed in order to see his plan realized.

The shop would open in a location that belongs to Oscar’s mother, and it would be free, so they won’t have to spend money to rent the location. Oscar has high expectations and hopes that this will help generate good income, more than they currently earn, since they now have a son and they want to begin to save for his education.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Oscar Nicolás Martínez esta casado con la señora Juana Teodora Torales y tienen un hijo. Oscar tiene un negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de equipos informáticos desde el año 2006, el cual ha crecido con el tiempo consolidando su clientela reconocimiento por el buen trabajo que realiza.

Como el negocio del señor Oscar es la única fuente de ingreso de la familia el desea invertir unos ahorros para montar un copetín (lugar de ventas de comidas rápidas) en donde pueda atender su esposa y vender comidas rápidas y gaseosas. Además del dinero que tienen ahorrado y destinado para esto, Oscar necesita un crédito con el que podrán adquirir todos los utensilios e insumos necesarios para poder ver su meta realizada.

El mismo será abierto en un local que pertenece a la madre de Oscar, y que está libre, por lo que no gastarán en alquiler del local. Oscar tiene muchas expectativas y desea que esto los ayude a generar buenos ingresos, más aun ahora que ya tienen un hijo y desean empezar a ahorrar para los estudio del mismo.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, chairs, display cabinets, tables, table cloths, meat, flour, soda pop, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise to continue supply his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy material to improve school uniforms

loans.name: La Antorcha Futura Group

texts.en:
Illuminada lives in Samana, a city on the east coast of the Dominican Republic. She has three children, ages 22, 20 and 18, and runs a small cafeteria from her home, where she sells fruit, bread, cheese, sugar and other daily essentials to her community. In her free time she enjoys talking with her neighbors and sharing stories about their families, businesses and lives. Her favorite foods are rice, beans and meat. Her dream for the future is to watch her business continue to grow bigger and bigger, and to be a successful business owner in her town.

This is the first loan that the women of La Antorcha Futura (The Future Torch) have applied for, and they are excited to see how it will transform their lives and the lives of other women in the community. On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for your support. We are looking forward to watching these women improve their lives!

loans.use: To buy more essentials such as beans, lentils and vegetables for her cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supply her business with merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in utensils and food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in purchasing more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Señor Benjamín M. is 39 years old. He is married to Rosa Aranda and is the father of a precious school aged daughter that is the source of the couple’s happiness. They live in the city of Ybycuí and thanks to their efforts today they own their own home.

Benjamín is the proprietor of a grocery store. In order to begin his small business he received the help of his father, who gave him the capital necessary to start his own enterprise. With time, he expanded the business with the profits he had obtained. Today Benjamín has a little cargo truck that he uses for merchandise distribution around the city’s neighborhoods.

This is how every day he progresses and augments his capital. Now he wants to acquire a loan in order to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and by this method be better able to get important discounts that help him to compete with good prices without diminishing his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Benjamín M. de 39 años de edad casado con Rosa Aranda es padre de una preciosa criatura en edad escolar que es la alegría de la pareja. Ellos viven en la ciudad de Ybycuí y gracias a sus esfuerzos hoy día ya cuentan con casa propia.

Benjamín es propietario de una despensa, para montar su pequeño negocio recibió la ayuda de su padre quien le otorgo el capital necesario para iniciar su emprendimiento. Con el tiempo fue expandiendo el negocio con las ganancias obtenidas, hoy día, Benjamín, ya cuenta con un camioncito de cargas que lo utiliza para el reparto de mercaderías por los barrios de la ciudad.

Es así que cada día progresa y aumenta su capital, y hoy día el esta deseoso de poder adquirir un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor ya que de este modo consigue importantes descuentos que lo ayudan a competir con buenos precios sin disminuir sus ganancias.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vermicelli, coffee, cleaning products, canning supplies, meat, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Edi

texts.es:
Edi P. is 38 years old, and he lives in the neighborhood Santa Teresita de Ybycuí. He is married to Maria Agüero, a 40 year old woman. Together they have two school aged children.

They have a store that they began three years ago thanks to capital he received as payment of a contract from a cotton maker, where he had worked for more than 25 years.

Edi wants to have better volume at his micro-enterprise and to augment his existing stock. With the income that he acquires from his business he will maintain his family and offer them a better quality of life.

With the loan he will buy rice, sugar, flour, vermicelli, vegetables, fruits, soda pops, sweets, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Edi P. de 38 años de edad vive en el barrio Santa Teresita de Ybycuí, esta casado con la Sra. Maria Agüero de 40 años, tienen dos hijos menores en edad escolar.

Poseen una despensa que iniciaron hace tres años gracias a un capital que recibió como pago de una indemnización de parte de una fabrica de algodón, donde presto servicio por mas de 25 años

El Sr. Edi desea dar mayor volumen a su micro empresa y aumentar su stock ya que con el ingreso que adquiere de su negocio mantiene a su familia y le brinda mejor calidad de vida.

Con el préstamo comprara arroz, azúcar, harina, fideos, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, flour, vermicelli, vegetables, fruits, soda pops, sweets, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and prime material for his store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Isabel M. is 60 years old. She lives in the city of Ybycuí, and is the single mother of three grown-up daughters.

Isabel is dedicated to sewing; from a very young age she was dedicated to this activity. Even when she was extremely young she would help her aunt, who was a seamstress. This is how she learned the necessary techniques and skills. With the passing of time, her skills were perfected and today they constitute the activity that generates income for her sustenance.

With the income obtained from her work she was able to give a good education to her daughters and to finish the construction of her small house with much sacrifice and honesty. Now she has gone to the Fundación asking for a loan that will allow her to buy cotton fabric of different colors in order to make items for the autumn.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel M. tiene 60 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Ybycuí, es madre soltera de tres hijas todas ya mayores de edad.

Isabel se dedica a la costura; desde muy joven se dedico a esta actividad ya que cuando era muy jovencita ayudaba a su tía que era modista, de este modo ella aprendió las técnicas y conocimientos necesarios. Con el correr de los tiempos se fue perfeccionando y hoy día constituye la actividad que le genera ingreso para su sustento.

Con las ganancias obtenidas pudo dar una buena educación a sus hijas y terminar la construcción de su pequeña casa con mucho sacrificio y honestidad. Ella hoy acude a la Fundación solicitando un crédito que le permitirá comprar telas de algodón de distintos colores para confeccionar prendas para el otoño.

loans.use: To buy cotton fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supply her business by purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Sr. Justo A. is 56 years old, and his wife, Sra. Blanca González, is 47 years old. They have four young children. They live together in a house that he managed to build after a great deal of effort.

Sr. Justo makes planters, tables, and laundry tubs out of stones. He makes these products by cutting and working with the stones. His wife has a nursery where she sells various kinds of plants that she also delivers to her customers.

They tell us that the income from these activities is used to give their children a better quality of life. The money was also used to complete the construction of their house that at the moment also serves as their place of work.

Sr. Justo’s dream is for his children to complete their education and become professionals. He is asking for a loan to buy cement and stones.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Justo A. de 56 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Blanca González de 47 años, tienen cuatro hijos menores de edad y todos viven juntos en una casa que logro construir con mucho sacrificio.

Don Justo se dedica a la fabricación de macetas, mesas y lavaderos de piedra. Justo elabora estos productos tallando y trabajando las piedras, su esposa tiene un vivero donde comercializa plantas de distintas variedades y se encarga de la distribución de los mismos.

Ellos nos cuentan que gracias a los ingresos que adquirieron de estas actividades logrorom dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y construir su casa en donde hoy día también constituye su local comercial.

Sueña que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser profesionales. Solicita el préstamo para compra de cemento y piedras.

loans.use: Purchase cement and stone

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Sr. Raúl Martínez Saucedo is single and lives with his parents. He and his mother work together in a corner store owned by Raúl. The business is located in a section of the house.

The business is four years old, and Raúl runs it with the help of his mother. She is very energetic and obliging. With the income from this business, they have been able to open a second store in which they sell goods such as toys, household items, and clothing. This store is located in the town’s municipal market.

They are asking for a loan to buy a freezer and a refrigerator so that they can carry a greater quantity of cold drinks to sell in the store. By doing this, they will increase their sales and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Raúl Martínez Saucedo es soltero, y vive con sus padres. Raúl trabaja junto con su madre en una bodega que es de Raúl. El negocio está ubicado en un predio de la casa.

Dicho negocio tiene una antigüedad de cuatro años, el cual atiende con la ayuda de su madre, que es una persona muy activa y, además, con buen carácter. Gracias a las ganancias que ha dejado este negocio, han podido abrir otro en donde venden artículos de mercería como juguetes, artículos para el hogar, ropas entre otras cosas; esto está ubicado en el mercado de Municipal de la ciudad.

Solicitan el crédito para la compra de un congelador y una heladera que les facilitará tener mayor cantidad de bebidas bien frías para la venta, esto ayudará a aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer and refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Investing in kitchen items

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Sra. Pabla S. is 57 years old and married to Sr. Tomás Cáceres. They have three children, two of whom are adults and one who is still a student.

Sra. Pabla makes cakes and other foods for special events such as weddings, coming-of-age parties, and first communions. To get the business up and running her parents gave her money to buy the oven and other necessary items.

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy ingredients to prepare sweet and savoury dishes: flour, sugar, corn, starch, dulce de leche, guava jelly, meat, eggs, salt, pasta etc.

Because of her enterprising nature Sra Pabla is able to help her farm manager husband with household income and expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Pabla S. tiene 57 años de edad, está casada con el Señor Tomás Cáceres, el matrimonio posee tres hijos, de los cuales dos ya son mayores de edad y uno aun está en edad escolar.

La Señora Pabla se dedica a la realización de tortas y comidas para eventos especiales, tales como: casamientos, fiestas de 15 años, primera comunión. Para poder dar inicio a esta actividad recibió la ayuda de sus padres, quienes le habían regalado el horno y los utensilios necesarios para dicho trabajo.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de las comidas y confites como ser: harina, azúcar, maíz, almidón, dulce de leche y guayaba, carne, huevos, sal, pasta, etc.

Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor la señora Pabla ayuda a su marido con los ingresos y gastos de la casa, quien trabaja como encargado de una estancia.

loans.use: To purchase items such as flour, sugar, corn, starch, dulce de leche, guava jelly, meat, eggs, salt, pasta etc

loans.name: Jovina

texts.es:
Jovina is single. She has had a general store in her own house for 6 years. She has many customers and is well-regarded in the neighbourhood for the good service she offers her clients.

In her store she sells items such as sugar, milk, yogurt, juice, soft drinks, candy, fruit, vegetables, rice, bread, eggs, oil, flour etc.

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy larger quantities of items in order to get cheaper prices and thus be more competitive. The investment will allow her to earn greater profits that she will be able to save. She is planning to construct a larger room opposite her house in which to locate her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Jovina es soltera, tiene una despensa en su domicilio particular desde hace 6 años, tiene mucha clientela y es muy reconocida en el barrio por el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes.

En su negocio vende artículos como azúcar, leche, yogurt, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, frutas, verduras, arroz, panes, huevos, aceite, harina, etc.

El crédito solicitado es para compra de mercaderías en cantidad, teniendo en cuenta que de esa forma consigue mejor precio y puede ser más competitivo. Dicha inversión le va a permitir obtener mayores beneficios que podrá ahorrar, pues la menta de Jovina es poder construir un salón más grande frente a su casa para ubicar su despensa ahí.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase different supplies for her store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Verón is a shopkeeper with the San Geronimo company in the town of Santa María Misiones. She is married and has two sons and two daughters. She and her husband Sr. Luis Ayala and the children live in their own house.

She is the owner of a business that sells general foodstuffs, clothing, shoes, and bazaar antiques that are at least 8 years old—things of that nature. She runs the business herself and is helped by her children. Her husband grows sugar cane, cassava, corn, green beans etc. on a 6-hectare piece of land that they own. The sugar cane is sold commercially, and the family consumes the rest. All their children are in either primary or secondary school. As the business and farm are well-managed, the children can attend school and the family are making improvements to their home.

Sra. Isabel is asking for a loan that she will use to buy sugar, dairy products, baked goods, flour, pasta, t-shirts, jeans, sports shoes etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La emprendedora Isabel Verón, comerciante de la compañía San Geronimo de la ciudad de Santa María Misiones, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 2 varones y 2 mujeres, viven en casa propia junto con sus hijos y su esposo el Sr. Luis Ayala.

Es propietaria de un comercio donde posee venta de comestibles en general, ropería, zapatería y venta de artículos de bazar con una antigüedad de 8 años en el ramo. Su negocio es atendido por ella misma y sus hijas que la ayudan, su esposo posee cultivos de caña dulce, mandioca, maíz, poroto, entre otros de los cuales comercializa la caña dulce y el resto lo utilizan para autoconsumo en un campo de su propiedad de 6 hectáreas.

Sus hijos todos se encuentran cursando sus estudios primarios y secundarios, gracias al buen manejo del negocio y sus cultivos sus hijos pueden acceder a recibir educación como así también realizan mejoras en su vivienda.

Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de mercaderías azúcar, lácteos, panificados, harina, pasta, remeras, jeans, calzados deportivos, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of items such as sugar, dairy products, baked goods, flour, pasta, t-shirts, jeans, sports shoes etc.

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
Our client, María Julia V., is a shopkeeper in the town of San Antonio in San Ignacio Misiones district. She is married and has a 20-year old daughter currently studying medicine in Cuba. Her daughter was awarded a full scholarship by the government of Misiones because of her excellent grades.

Sra. María owns a butcher’s shop in her own home, which is run by both her and her husband Sr. Paulo Cabrera. The shop has been operating for more than 16 years.

She is asking for a loan from our institution to buy two young bulls to slaughter and then sell in the butcher’s shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La Cliente Sra. Maria Julia V., comerciante de la ciudad de San Antonio distrito de San Ignacio Misiones, es casada y madre de 1 hija de 20 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra en Cuba estudiando medicina ya que obtuvo una beca de estudios completa que le fue otorgada por la Gobernación de Misiones debido a sus excelentes calificaciones.

La Sra. María posee una carnicería en su domicilio particular, la cual es atendido por la misma y su esposo el Sr. Paulo Cabrera, su carnicería la abrieron hace más de 16 años.

Solicita el préstamo en nuestra institución para la compra de 2 novillos para faenamiento y posterior venta en su carnicería.

loans.use: Purchase of young bulls to slaughter and sell the meat

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
Thelma Agüero is a both a college student and mechant. She, her parents and two brothers own a small family business.

Themla runs the general store/butcher shop along with her parents, who have owned the store for more than 15 years. On top of running the store, her mother buys vegetables at the wholesale market and resells them throughout the Misiones area, from Villa Florida to Ayolas. She sells the vegetables on a truck, which the family was able to purchase with the revenue brought in by their shop.

Thelma has requested this loan from our institution to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables for resale, due to the high demand that exists for these items.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Thelma Agüero, es estudiante universitaria y comerciante a la vez, ella posee un negocio familiar con sus padres y 2 hermanos.

Sus padres poseen el negocio hace ya más de 15 años, el negocio específicamente es una despensa y carnicería el cual es atendido por sus padres y ella. Además de esta actividad su madre se dedica a la compra de verduras del mercado de abasto para su posterior venta por todo el Dpto. De Misiones desde la ciudad de Villa Florida hasta la ciudad de Ayolas en cual lo realiza en un camioneta que pudieron adquirir gracias a las ganancias obtenidas por el negocio.

Thelma solicita el préstamo en nuestra institución para la compra de verduras, frutas entre otros para la posterior venta debido a la gran demanda que posee.

loans.use: Buy merchandise (fruit, vegetables, etc.)

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Mr. Vidal Caceres is the father of two children, one of whom starts grade school this year. Vidal used to live with relatives, but since his business has gone so well, he is now building his own home.

Vidal is a long-time businessman in our city. He sells articles of clothing, and also sews and sells aprons to butcher shops, meat lockers and supermarkets. Vidal personally delivers the merchandise by motorcycle within the Misiones area; he sometimes travels by bus to deliver large orders. Vidal says that he requests loans exclusively from our institution.

He is asking our institution for this loan so that he can purchase fabric, due to the high demand for his aprons from meat lockers and supermarkets.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Vidal C. padre de 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos empieza este año sus estudios primarios. Años anteriores el Sr. Vidal vivía en la casa de unos familiares y debido al buen resultado obtenido en su negocio esta pudiendo edificar para su propia vivienda.

Vidal es un comerciante antiguo de nuestra ciudad, se dedica a la venta de artículos de ropería como así también a la confección y venta de delantales para carnicerías, frigoríficos y supermercados. La venta de sus mercaderías lo realiza el mismo cliente en su moto dentro del Dpto. De Misiones o en ocasiones viaja en bus cuando realiza la entrega de sus pedidos grandes, Vidal cuenta que opera únicamente con nuestra institución para la solicitud de créditos.

Solicita este préstamo en nuestra institución para compra de telas debido a la gran demanda de delantales que posee de frigoríficos y supermercados.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase porcelain items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase school supplies and stationary

loans.name: Kuña Aty Barrio San Angel Group

texts.es:
This group of enterprising women is quite strong: they pay their quotas on time, and there are no problems within the group. The women are all in different lines of work: washing, cleaning, general stores, hair salons, clothing sales, fast food, etc.

They want to invest the loan in their businesses; each woman will receive an average of 400,000 guaranies. The women are very grateful to the Fundacion Paraguay for offering an advancement opportunity to women who work, both inside and outside the home. Above all, they are grateful that the foundation is concerned with the wellbeing of their children and the community in which they live.

The women say they are very happy to be able to work together and share their life experiences in their everyday work.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras se muestra bastante sólido, ellas no presentan atrasos en el pago de sus cuotas, ni problemas entre ellas. Ellas se dedican a distintos tipos de actividades como: lavanderas, limpiadoras, despensas, peluqueras, venta de ropas, comidas rápidas, etc.

Todas desean invertir el crédito que reciban en sus negocios, el promedio que recibió cada integrante es de 400.000 guaraníes. Estas señoras se muestran muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por ofrecer una oportunidad de salir adelante a todas las mujeres que trabajan dentro y fuera de sus hogares, y sobre todo que busca el bienestar de sus hijos y de toda la comunidad en donde viven.

Ellas manifiestan que se sienten muy contentas de poder trabajar juntas y compartir experiencias de vida en su día a día de trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase cleaning supplies, hair products (shampoo, creams and dyes), and general store merchandise (sugar, flour, oil, pasta, other cooking ingredients).

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is 30 years old. She is married to Angel Benitez, 32, who has worked as a driver for more than 20 years and helps pay for household expenses. They have one son, still a child, who lives with them.

She launched the business three years ago on her own initiative after realizing that there was no general store in the neighborhood. This helps explain why her sales have been so good and why she already has a loyal customer base.

Eva needs the loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, flour, yerba mate, rice, pasta, and bread.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Eva tiene 30 años de edad está casada con Ángel Benítez, de 32 años, quien trabaja como chofer hace más de veinte años, aportando para los gastos del hogar. Tienen un hijo, menor de edad que vive con ellos.

Inició el negocio hace tres años por iniciativa propia, percatándose de que no había una despensa en el barrio, lo cual ayuda a que las ventas sean muy buenas y ya cuenta con clientela formada.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías en general como azúcar, harina, yerba, arroz, fideos, panificados y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise: sugar, flour, yerba mate, rice, pasta, bread, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is 65 years old, separated, and has her own house.

Gloria began to work when she was very young, and has been working as a seamstress for more than 40 years. Thanks to her tireless work, all of her children were able to finish their studies. .

Today, her three children are all college-educated, working professionals, and support her economically by paying for household expenses. .

Gloria has been commissioned to make skirts for traditional dances, and she needs the loan to buy fabric. Making the skirts is a very special task that requires time and patience.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Gloria tiene 65 años de edad, es separada, tiene casa propia.

Gloria empezó desde muy joven a trabajar, tiene más de 40 años trabajando como modista. Gracias a su incansable labor, logró que todos sus hijos terminaran sus estudios.

Actualmente sus tres hijos son profesionales universitarios y están trabajando, apoyándola económicamente en los gastos familiares.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de telas, ya que posee pedidos de faldas para danzas folklóricas y que llevan un trabajo muy especial, tiempo, y paciencia.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Palmiro

texts.es:
Palmiro is 67 years old. He and his wife Delia own a shop together, and thanks to their hard work and sacrifice they now own their own home.

Palmiro began to work at the shop more than 50 years ago with his parents. He also owns some cows and sells their milk. Palmiro and Delia's niece also works with them; she helps out at the shop and with the housework.

Palmiro needs this loan to purchase merchandise like rice, pasta, dairy, oil, drinks, and bread so that he can bring in more revenue, since he is spending more in order to pay for his niece's college education.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

Palmiro tiene 67 años de edad, él está casado con Delia y ambos son comerciantes, y ya cuentan con casa propia gracias al sacrificio de ambos.

Palmiro empezó a trabajar en la despensa con sus padres hace más de 50 años, también se dedica a la venta de leche ya que tiene animales vacunos. Actualmente trabajan con ellos una sobrina suya, ayudándoles en la despensa y en las labores hogareñas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como arroz, fideos, lácteos, aceite, bebidas, panificados, bebidas y otros, para obtener mayores ingresos ya que los estudios universitarios de su sobrina demandan mayores gastos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise: rice, dairy, bread, oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo is 28 years old, he is single and lives with his parents in the city of Carapeguá. He is studying Business Administration at one of the local universities, and is in his final year. Once he has completed this he will be able to fulfill his dream of starting a professional career.

Arnaldo has worked hard from a very early age, starting by selling clothes with his father. Thanks to this, he managed to earn his own income and generate enough capital to stand on his own two feet. Four years ago he started buying his own goods to sell; goods such as sports shoes, clothes and bedspreads. He has a well-established customer base, thanks to the large number of contacts he now has.

He is applying for a loan so that he can buy goods such as bedspreads, sports shoes and trousers in larger volumes, which will enable him to get good discounts on his purchases.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Arnaldo es un joven de 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá, ésta cursando el último año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en una de las Universidades de la zona, dando así cumplimiento a un anhelado sueño que es la de ser profesional.

Desde muy temprana edad tuvo inclinación hacia el trabajo se inicio trabajando con su padre en ventas de ropas , y gracias a esta actividad se fue ganando sus propios ingresos que le genero un capital importante para independizarse. Es así que hace 4 años empezó a comprar sus propias mercaderías para la venta como calzados deportivos, ropas y sobrecamas, gracias a la gran cantidad de conocidos que tiene hoy día ya posee muy buena clientela formada.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías como sobrecamas, calzados deportivos y pantalones en grandes cantidades, pudiendo así conseguir buenos descuentos en sus compras.

loans.use: To buy goods such as bedspreads, sports shoes and trousers in large volumes

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
Román is 56 years old and works as a street trader, selling household goods. He is married to Isabel González, who has a storehouse and helps with the family’s living expenses. They live in their own home and have two grown-up children, who were able to start a professional career, thanks to the efforts of their parents.

At a very young age, Román started working with his father as a salesman. With the profits generated from the business, he bought a motorcycle and started working for himself more than 15 years ago.

Every day, he travels long distances on his motorcycle, selling door-to-door. Two of his cousins work with him and he trains them and pays them for their services.

He needs this loan to buy goods such as bedsheets, saucepans, coolers, flasks and cutlery.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Román tiene 56 años de edad y se dedica a la venta ambulante de articulos para el hogar. El está casado con Isabel González quien tiene una despensa, ayudándole con los ingresos de la familia, ellos viven en casa propia y tienen dos hijos mayores de edad quienes adquirieron una profesión gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres.

Román empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre como vendedor, con las ganancias que le generaron el negocio el pudo comprar una moto y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia hace más de 15 años .

Realiza las ventas casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilómetros diariamente. Trabaja con él dos sobrinos a quienes les enseña la profesión y a la vez les paga por los servicios prestados.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como sábanas, cacerolas, ventilador, termos, cubiertos y otros.

loans.use: To buy goods such as bedsheets, saucepans, coolers, flasks and cutlery

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido is 30 years old and is married to Cristina Mendoza. They live in their own home, and have a seven-year-old son, who attends school.

When Wilfrido was very young, he went to Argentina in search of work. He worked there in a photocopying, printing and binding company. Five years ago he returned home to open his own business.

His company is in a strategic position, located in the city centre, where he also carries out typing and printing work. He is currently working with his cousin, whose education fees he covers. He needs this loan so that he can buy a colour photocopier.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Wilfrido tiene 30 años de edad, está casado con Cristina Mendoza, ellos viven en casa propia, tiene un hijo de 7 años quien va a la escuela.

Wilfrido cuando muy joven viajo a la Argnetina en busca de trabajo, trabajo en un negocio donde se realizaban fotocopias, impresiones y encuadernaciones, y hace cinco años volvió al país y abrió su propio local.

La ubicación de su negocio es estratégica, está en el centro de la ciudad, también realiza trabajos de tipeo e impresiones a computadora. Actualmente trabaja con él un sobrino, a quien le costea los gastos de sus estudios en la facultad.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una fotocopiadora a color.

loans.use: To buy a colour photocopier

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José M. is 50 years old and has been married toAna Celia Caballero de M. for over 23 years. They have five grown-up children who now have professional careers, thanks to the hard work and support of their parents.

From a very young age, José started working with his father, selling traditional and local products, such as bedspreads and handmade hammocks. He sells his goods in the region of San Juan Misiones which consists of several cities. He has been doing this for more than 20 years, and thanks to his hard work and effort, he was able to buy a motorcycle which he uses to carry out his sales activities.

In addtion to his work as a street trader, two years ago he started working as a security guard at the Carapeguá campus of the Catholic University, earning him a minimum income which helps him to contribute to the houshold expenses, and also to support his parents who are dependent on him.

He is applying for this loan so that he can buy goods to sell, such as hammocks, blankets, belts and bedsheets, which are produced by local craftswomen.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. José M. tiene 50 años de edad y esta casado con la Sra. Ana Celia Caballero de M. hace mas de 23 años, ellos tienen cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad que gracias al trabajo y apoyo de sus padres ya son profesionales.

Él Sr. José desde muy temprana edad comenzó a trabajar con su padre saliendo a vender productos tradicionales de la zona como sobrecamas y hamacas de hilo hechas a mano, realiza su venta por la zona de San Juan Misiones que comprende varias ciudades. Hace más de 20 años que realiza esta actividad y gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprarse una motocicleta con la cual realiza sus ventas.

Aparte de su trabajo como vendedor ambulante, hace dos años empezó a trabajar como guardia de seguridad en la Universidad Católica filial Carapeguá, donde tiene un ingreso mínimo que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su casa y también mantener a sus padres que dependen de él.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para la venta como hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas típicas hechas por artesanas de la ciudad.

loans.use: To buy goods such as bedspreads, belts, tablecloths and bedsheets

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
Lino C. is 45 years old and has been married to Domitila Morel for 20 years. They have three children. Lina worked as a chauffer at a company for 15 years. Seeing the need to earn a higher income, he decided to become self-employed, selling blankets and hammocks which are woven by his wife. 7 years ago he managed to establish a signifant client base in the area where he markets his products.

It’s worth mentioning that thanks to Lino’s efforts, he was able to build a house and provide his children with an education. He is applying for this loan so that he can buy cotton thread in different colours - to produce and sell bedspreads and hammocks.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr Lino C. tiene 45 años está casado hace 20 años con la Sra. Domitila Morel, tienen tres hijos. Lina trabajo durante 15 años trabajó como chofer en una casa comercial y viendo la necesidad de contar con más ingreso decidió trabajar por cuenta propia en la venta de frazadas y hamacas que su señora teje. Hace 7 años que se dedica a actividad por lo que ya pudo lograr formar una cantidad muy importante de clientela en la zona donde comercializa sus productos.

Cabe mencionar que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo construir una casa y darles educación a sus hijos. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de algodón de distintos colores para la confección de sobrecamas y hamacas para la venta.

loans.use: To buy cotton thread in different colours

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
Milciades is 20 years old, single and has no children. This young entrepreneur started work as an assistant in an auto repair shop, where he worked for five years, and learned all that was needed so that he could become self-employed.

Thanks to his dedication and decision-making, he now has his own small business, run from his home, repairing cars and selling spare parts for cars. The business is getting more and more clients and higher stock levels, which highlights the successful management skills of this entrepreneur.

He plans to use this loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Milciades tiene 20 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, este joven emprendedor comenzó como ayudante en un taller mecánico de vehículos donde trabajo durante cinco años llegando a aprender todo lo necesario para poder independizarse.
